title: 普京：俄中关系将继续深化发展，取得新成就
content:
俄罗斯总统普京18日表示，俄中关系将继续深化发展，取得新成就，并造福两国人民。
当地时间18日凌晨，普京在竞选总部发表讲话，感谢选民支持。他在接受新华社记者提问时表示，俄中关系经过多年发展，非常稳定，具有很强互补性。
普京指出，俄中两国在经济、外交等领域有诸多契合点。就亚欧地区发展而言，俄中关系是一个重要稳定因素，中方提出的共建“一带一路”倡议非常重要。
普京积极评价中国的发展成就。他认为，中国正在非常自信地实现飞速发展，并向创新型经济转型；中国在国际舞台上日益活跃并取得巨大成功，在世界各地拥有许多朋友。
普京强调，台湾是中国不可分割的一部分；那些在台湾周围进行挑衅并采取种种措施迟滞中国发展的企图，无疑会彻底失败。
据俄罗斯中央选举委员会当地时间18日凌晨公布的数据，在此次总统选举已统计完成的85％选票中，普京以87.19％的得票率大幅领先其他候选人，实际已经赢得总统选举。
俄罗斯第八届总统选举正式投票于15日至17日举行。根据俄总统选举规则，获得50％以上选票者当选总统。俄中央选举委员会将不晚于3月28日确认此次总统选举的最终结果，并在选举结果确认后3日内予以公布。
translation:
Russian President Vladimir Putin stated on the 18th that Russia-China relations will continue to deepen and develop, achieve new achievements, and benefit the people of both countries.
In the early morning of the 18th local time, Putin delivered a speech at the campaign headquarters, thanking voters for their support. When accepting questions from Xinhua News Agency reporters, he said that after years of development, Russia-China relations are very stable and highly complementary.
Putin pointed out that Russia and China have many points of convergence in economic, diplomatic and other fields. As far as the development of the Eurasian region is concerned, Russia-China relations are an important stabilizing factor, and the joint construction of the "Belt and Road" initiative proposed by China is very important.
Putin spoke positively of China's development achievements. He believes that China is achieving rapid development with great confidence and transforming into an innovative economy; China is increasingly active on the international stage and has achieved great success, and has many friends around the world.
Putin emphasized that Taiwan is an inalienable part of China; those attempts to provoke provocations around Taiwan and take various measures to delay China's development will undoubtedly fail completely.
According to data released by the Russian Central Election Commission in the early morning of the 18th local time, of the 85% of votes that have been counted in this presidential election, Putin led other candidates by a wide margin with 87.19% of the votes, and has actually won the presidential election.
Official voting for Russia’s eighth presidential election will be held from the 15th to the 17th. According to Russian presidential election rules, the person who gets more than 50% of the votes is elected president. The Russian Central Election Commission will confirm the final results of the presidential election no later than March 28 and announce them within 3 days after the election results are confirmed.
input:

When accepting questions from Xinhua News Agency reporters, he said that after years of development, Russia-China relations are very stable and highly complementary.
Putin pointed out that Russia and China have many points of convergence in economic, diplomatic and other fields. As far as the development of the Eurasian region is concerned, Russia-China relations are an important stabilizing factor, and the joint construction of the "Belt and Road" initiative proposed by China is very important.
Putin spoke positively of China's development achievements. He believes that China is achieving rapid development with great confidence and transforming into an innovative economy; China is increasingly active on the international stage and has achieved great success, and has many friends around the world.
Putin emphasized that Taiwan is an inalienable part of China; those attempts to provoke provocations around Taiwan and take various measures to delay China's development will undoubtedly fail completely.
According to data released by the Russian Central Election Commission in the early morning of the 18th local time, of the 85% of votes that have been counted in this presidential election, Putin led other candidates by a wide margin with 87.19% of the votes, and has actually won the presidential election.
Official voting for Russia’s eighth presidential election will be held from the 15th to the 17th. According to Russian presidential election rules, the person who gets more than 50% of the votes is elected president. The Russian Central Election Commission will confirm the final results of the presidential election no later than March 28 and announce them within 3 days after the election results are confirmed.

title: 俄大选最后一天：“中午反普京”行动引爆全球-环球大观-万维读者网（电脑版）
content:
在另一个投票站，另一位年轻女性也以同样的方式伪装了自己的身份，她说她把票投给了与普京竞争的三位候选人中"最不可疑的一位"。

俄罗斯总统选举最后一天，在俄罗斯大使馆外排队的人们。2024年3月17日英国伦敦 REUTERS - Kevin Coombs
“变化在最意想不到的时候发生”
一名在莫斯科参加投票的男学生告诉纳瓦尔尼的频道，像他这样不同意现行制度的人必须不顾一切地生活下去。
他说，因为“历史表明，变化总是在最意想不到的时候发生”。
路透社说，示威者只占俄罗斯 1.14 亿选民中的一小部分，而普京先生已准备好在这次选举中加强他对权力的控制，他应该会在这次选举中取得压倒性胜利。
俄罗斯外交部发言人玛丽亚-扎哈罗娃对在外国使馆投票的人都是普京的反对者的说法表示质疑，并指责西方媒体散布有关事件的宣传。
克里姆林宫将纳瓦尔尼的政治盟友（其中大部分驻在俄罗斯境外）视为危险的极端分子，他们代表西方破坏国家稳定。报告称，普京在普通俄罗斯民众中享有压倒性的支持，并指出民意调查显示他的支持率超过80%。
由于俄罗斯幅员辽阔，横跨11个时区，参加抗议的选民分散，因此很难估计有多少人参加了抗议活动。
纳瓦尔尼频道显示，今天中午在每个投票站排队的人数从几十人到数百人不等。
有些投票站有数千人
路透社记者看到，中午时分，莫斯科和叶卡捷琳堡一些投票站的选民尤其是年轻人的流量略有增加，排队的人有数百人，有的地方甚至有数千人。
一些人表示，他们是在抗议，尽管表面上看不出什么迹象可以将他们与普通选民区分开来。
据上周在立陶宛遭锤子袭击的纳瓦尔尼的助手列昂尼德·沃尔科夫估计，莫斯科、圣彼得堡、叶卡捷琳堡和其他城市有“数十万人”（正午）来到投票站。
translation:
At another polling station, another young woman who had similarly disguised her identity said she had voted for the "least suspicious" of the three candidates running against Putin.

People queue outside the Russian Embassy on the last day of the Russian presidential election. London, UK, March 17, 2024 REUTERS - Kevin Coombs
“Change happens when least expected”
A male student who voted in Moscow told Navalny's channel that people like him who disagree with the current system have to live regardless.
Because "history shows that change always happens when least expected," he said.
Reuters said the demonstrators constituted only a small portion of Russia's 114 million voters and that Mr Putin was poised to tighten his grip on power in an election that should deliver a landslide victory.
Russian Foreign Ministry spokesperson Maria Zakharova questioned the idea that those who voted at foreign embassies were Putin opponents and accused Western media of spreading propaganda about the incident.
The Kremlin views Navalny's political allies, most of whom are based outside Russia, as dangerous extremists who destabilize the country on behalf of the West. Putin enjoys overwhelming support among ordinary Russians, the report said, noting that polls show his approval rating exceeds 80 percent.
It is difficult to estimate how many people took part in the protests, as Russia is a vast country spanning 11 time zones and voters participating in the protests were dispersed.
Navalny's channel showed the number of people lining up at each polling station at noon today ranged from dozens to hundreds.
Some polling stations had thousands of people
Reuters reporters saw that at noon, the flow of voters, especially young people, increased slightly at some polling stations in Moscow and Yekaterinburg. There were hundreds of people queuing, and in some places there were even thousands of people.
Some said they were protesting, although there was little on the surface to distinguish them from ordinary voters.
Leonid Volkov, an aide to Navalny who was hammered in Lithuania last week, estimated that "hundreds of thousands" of people came to the polls (at noon) in Moscow, St. Petersburg, Yekaterinburg and other cities.
input:
At another polling station, another young woman who had similarly disguised her identity said she had voted for the "least suspicious" of the three candidates running against Putin.

People queue outside the Russian Embassy on the last day of the Russian presidential election. London, UK, March 17, 2024 REUTERS - Kevin Coombs

Because "history shows that change always happens when least expected," he said.
Reuters said the demonstrators constituted only a small portion of Russia's 114 million voters and that Mr Putin was poised to tighten his grip on power in an election that should deliver a landslide victory.
Russian Foreign Ministry spokesperson Maria Zakharova questioned the idea that those who voted at foreign embassies were Putin opponents and accused Western media of spreading propaganda about the incident.
The Kremlin views Navalny's political allies, most of whom are based outside Russia, as dangerous extremists who destabilize the country on behalf of the West. Putin enjoys overwhelming support among ordinary Russians, the report said, noting that polls show his approval rating exceeds 80 percent.
It is difficult to estimate how many people took part in the protests, as Russia is a vast country spanning 11 time zones and voters participating in the protests were dispersed.
Navalny's channel showed the number of people lining up at each polling station at noon today ranged from dozens to hundreds.
Some polling stations had thousands of people
Reuters reporters saw that at noon, the flow of voters, especially young people, increased slightly at some polling stations in Moscow and Yekaterinburg. There were hundreds of people queuing, and in some places there were even thousands of people.
Some said they were protesting, although there was little on the surface to distinguish them from ordinary voters.
Leonid Volkov, an aide to Navalny who was hammered in Lithuania last week, estimated that "hundreds of thousands" of people came to the polls (at noon) in Moscow, St. Petersburg, Yekaterinburg and other cities.

title: Реакция мировых СМИ на победу Владимира Путина
content:
А о популярности действующего президента, выразившейся в беспрецедентных реальных цифрах, написала и австрийская газета eXXpress:
В результате голосования Владимир Путин получил чуть менее 88% голосов — это рекордный результат. Таким образом, он набрал на десять процентных пунктов больше по сравнению с выборами 2018 года.
Трое конкурентов Путина с самого начала имели невысокие шансы. Коммунист Николай Харитонов получил, согласно первоначальным результатам, чуть более 4% голосов; Владислав Даванков из либеральной партии "Новые люди" — чуть менее 4%; либерал-демократ Леонид Слуцкий набрал около 3%.
translation:
And the Austrian newspaper eXXpress also wrote about the popularity of the current president, expressed in unprecedented real figures:
As a result of the voting, Vladimir Putin received just under 88% of the vote - this is a record result. Thus, he gained ten percentage points compared to the 2018 elections.
Putin's three competitors had low chances from the very beginning. Communist Nikolai Kharitonov received, according to initial results, just over 4% of the vote; Vladislav Davankov from the liberal New People party - just under 4%; liberal democrat Leonid Slutsky gained about 3%.
input:
And the Austrian newspaper eXXpress also wrote about the popularity of the current president, expressed in unprecedented real figures:
As a result of the voting, Vladimir Putin received just under 88% of the vote - this is a record result. Thus, he gained ten percentage points compared to the 2018 elections.
Putin's three competitors had low chances from the very beginning. Communist Nikolai Kharitonov received, according to initial results, just over 4% of the vote; Vladislav Davankov from the liberal New People party - just under 4%; liberal democrat Leonid Slutsky gained about 3%.

title: In Russian presidential election, voting is forced at gunpoint in occupied Ukraine - The Washington Post
content:
Everything is broken,” the person said. “Against this backdrop, the presidential elections are just some kind of crap.”
The resident said people were forced to apply for Russian identity documents to receive social payments since early in the occupation, but new rules now require them to have Russian documents for everything from property titles of homes to drivers’ licenses. Many people are anxious, amid rumors that anyone with Ukrainian documents could be evicted.
In a post on Telegram, Ukraine’s military intelligence directorate, HUR, accused Russian forces of using “intimidation, bribery, and pressure” to force Ukrainians to vote.
Some Ukrainians who were being collared by election teams were asked to fill out ballots in front of pro-Kremlin election workers and soldiers — violating the principle of a secret ballot, a core tenet of democracy.
One woman in occupied Enerhodar in the Zaporizhzhia region was at her daughter’s apartment when she heard a knock on the door.
“It was two representatives from the polling station and two seeming military personnel in balaclavas with rifles, carrying ballot boxes,” the woman’s daughter, a former city council staffer who has fled the area, recounted. The woman and her daughter spoke on the condition of anonymity to protect the safety of family members living under occupation.
“My mother had no intention of voting, but still, she was afraid to say so aloud,” the daughter said. Instead, the mother said she did not live at the apartment and would vote later.
Other Enerhodar residents told election officials and soldiers that they had already voted, “to which they replied, ‘No problem, you can vote again,’” the daughter said. Men who could not produce Russian passports were questioned and their apartments searched, she said.
input:
Everything is broken,” the person said. “Against this backdrop, the presidential elections are just some kind of crap.”
The resident said people were forced to apply for Russian identity documents to receive social payments since early in the occupation, but new rules now require them to have Russian documents for everything from property titles of homes to drivers’ licenses. Many people are anxious, amid rumors that anyone with Ukrainian documents could be evicted.
In a post on Telegram, Ukraine’s military intelligence directorate, HUR, accused Russian forces of using “intimidation, bribery, and pressure” to force Ukrainians to vote.
Some Ukrainians who were being collared by election teams were asked to fill out ballots in front of pro-Kremlin election workers and soldiers — violating the principle of a secret ballot, a core tenet of democracy.
One woman in occupied Enerhodar in the Zaporizhzhia region was at her daughter’s apartment when she heard a knock on the door.
“It was two representatives from the polling station and two seeming military personnel in balaclavas with rifles, carrying ballot boxes,” the woman’s daughter, a former city council staffer who has fled the area, recounted. The woman and her daughter spoke on the condition of anonymity to protect the safety of family members living under occupation.
“My mother had no intention of voting, but still, she was afraid to say so aloud,” the daughter said. Instead, the mother said she did not live at the apartment and would vote later.
Other Enerhodar residents told election officials and soldiers that they had already voted, “to which they replied, ‘No problem, you can vote again,’” the daughter said. Men who could not produce Russian passports were questioned and their apartments searched, she said.

title: «Россия – это Путин»: политические последствия 87% президента
content:
Фраза «завтра мы проснемся в другой стране» настолько затерта, что я как-то даже стесняюсь ее употреблять. Стесняюсь – и абсолютно правильно делаю. Страна будет той же самой, но ее политическая система все же несколько изменится. На момент вечера последнего дня выборов ни один из так называемых «соперников» Путина не дотянул даже до планки в 5%. Олицетворяемая Николаем Харитоновым коммунистическая оппозиция самоликвидировалась. Олицетворяемая Владиславом Даванковым умеренная либеральная фронда умерла, не успев по-настоящему родиться. Леонид Слуцкий, если использовать некогда прогремевшую путинскую фразу, доказал, что он «не Робеспьер» (ой, простите, не Жириновский). Оппозиции (или даже тени оппозиции) ныне действующему президенту в России 2024 года нет и быть не может – теперь это признано и доказано официально.

Любой результат требует грамотной интерпретации. И вот как, на мой взгляд, будет выглядеть доминирующая интерпретация полученных Владимиром Путиным 87% голосов. В феврале 2022 Россия под руководством Путина сделала то, что на в современной международной реальности давно не решалось ни одно государство мира: бросила вызов американской гегемонии, «миру, основанному на правилах», произвольно придуманных в Вашингтоне и столь же произвольно им выполняемых (или не выполняемых). В ответ Запад обрушил на Россию «девятый вал» санкций и репрессий, попытался прижать ее к ногтю, попытался организовать раскол между простым населением страны и ее руководством.
translation: Any result requires competent interpretation. And this is what, in my opinion, the dominant interpretation of the 87% of votes received by Vladimir Putin will look like. In February 2022, Russia, under the leadership of Putin, did something that no state in the world has dared to do for a long time in modern international reality: it challenged American hegemony, a “world based on rules” arbitrarily invented in Washington and equally arbitrarily implemented by it (or not performed). In response, the West unleashed a “ninth wave” of sanctions and repression on Russia, tried to pin it down, tried to organize a split between the country’s ordinary population and its leadership.
input: Any result requires competent interpretation. And this is what, in my opinion, the dominant interpretation of the 87% of votes received by Vladimir Putin will look like. In February 2022, Russia, under the leadership of Putin, did something that no state in the world has dared to do for a long time in modern international reality: it challenged American hegemony, a “world based on rules” arbitrarily invented in Washington and equally arbitrarily implemented by it (or not performed). In response, the West unleashed a “ninth wave” of sanctions and repression on Russia, tried to pin it down, tried to organize a split between the country’s ordinary population and its leadership.

title: Путин побеждает с 87,28 % голосов: как прошли самые скандальные выборы в истории России. Главные итоги выборов президента России 2024
content:
Что в итоге?
Выборы президента России 2024 года стали триумфом Владимира Путина и в то же время выявили глубокий раскол в обществе. С одной стороны, действующий президент получил рекордную поддержку избирателей и укрепил свою власть на новый срок. С другой стороны, выборы сопровождались многочисленными нарушениями, протестами и критикой со стороны оппозиции и Запада.

Очевидно, что легитимность этих выборов и дальнейшая устойчивость сложившейся системы будут во многом зависеть от способности власти обеспечить реальный рост уровня жизни населения, снизить социальное неравенство и найти новые точки опоры в обществе. В противном случае, рекордная явка и результат Путина могут оказаться пирровой победой, за которой последуют нарастание протестных настроений и углубление кризиса в стране.

Пока же Россия вступает в новый политический цикл с привычным лидером и набором проблем. И от того, удастся ли Путину и его команде найти адекватные ответы на эти вызовы, будет зависеть будущее страны на годы вперед. А пока остается только наблюдать за развитием событий и надеяться на лучшее. Ведь, как говорится, "надежда умирает последней". Даже в российской политике.
translation:
What's the result?
The 2024 Russian presidential elections were a triumph for Vladimir Putin and at the same time revealed deep divisions in society. On the one hand, the incumbent president received record voter support and strengthened his power for a new term. On the other hand, the elections were accompanied by numerous violations, protests and criticism from the opposition and the West.

It is obvious that the legitimacy of these elections and the further stability of the existing system will largely depend on the ability of the authorities to ensure a real increase in the standard of living of the population, reduce social inequality and find new points of support in society. Otherwise, Putin’s record turnout and result may turn out to be a Pyrrhic victory, followed by an increase in protest sentiments and a deepening of the crisis in the country.

In the meantime, Russia is entering a new political cycle with a familiar leader and a set of problems. And the future of the country for years to come will depend on whether Putin and his team will be able to find adequate answers to these challenges. For now, all we can do is watch the developments and hope for the best. After all, as they say, “hope dies last.” Even in Russian politics.
input:
What's the result?
The 2024 Russian presidential elections were a triumph for Vladimir Putin and at the same time revealed deep divisions in society. On the one hand, the incumbent president received record voter support and strengthened his power for a new term. On the other hand, the elections were accompanied by numerous violations, protests and criticism from the opposition and the West.

It is obvious that the legitimacy of these elections and the further stability of the existing system will largely depend on the ability of the authorities to ensure a real increase in the standard of living of the population, reduce social inequality and find new points of support in society. Otherwise, Putin’s record turnout and result may turn out to be a Pyrrhic victory, followed by an increase in protest sentiments and a deepening of the crisis in the country.

In the meantime, Russia is entering a new political cycle with a familiar leader and a set of problems. And the future of the country for years to come will depend on whether Putin and his team will be able to find adequate answers to these challenges. For now, all we can do is watch the developments and hope for the best. After all, as they say, “hope dies last.” Even in Russian politics.

title: 俄媒：普京以在线形式参加俄罗斯总统选举投票
content:
俄罗斯联邦第八届总统选举正式投票于3月15日至17日举行。据“今日俄罗斯”（RT）报道，3月15日，克宫发布消息称，俄罗斯总统普京以在线形式参加俄罗斯总统选举的投票。
俄罗斯总统普京以在线形式参加俄罗斯总统选举的投票。图源：RT视频截图

此外，RT援引俄新社消息称，3月15日，俄罗斯联邦安全会议副主席梅德韦杰夫前往投票站参加俄罗斯总统选举投票。
据媒体报道，位于俄罗斯领土最东端的堪察加边疆区、楚科奇自治区等地的投票站于当地时间15日8时开放，2024年俄总统选举投票正式开始。俄现任总统普京、来自俄自由民主党的斯卢茨基、俄联邦共产党的哈里托诺夫和俄新人党的达万科夫将竞选下一届总统。
根据《俄罗斯联邦总统选举法》，总统是俄国家元首，每届任期6年。任何年满35岁，在俄常住25年以上，且现在和过去都未拥有其他国家国籍的俄联邦公民均可以竞选总统。根据规定，总统选举计票工作将在投票结束后开始。俄中央选举委员会将不晚于3月28日确认选举最终结果，并在确认后3日内公布。
translation:
Official voting for the eighth presidential election of the Russian Federation will be held from March 15 to 17. According to "Russia Today" (RT), on March 15, the Kremlin Palace announced that Russian President Vladimir Putin will participate in the Russian presidential election online.
Russian President Vladimir Putin took part in voting in Russia's presidential election online. Source: RT video screenshot

In addition, RT quoted RIA News Agency as saying that on March 15, Medvedev, Vice Chairman of the Russian Federation Security Council, went to the polling station to vote in the Russian presidential election.
According to media reports, polling stations in Kamchatka Krai, Chukotka Autonomous Region and other places located in the easternmost part of Russian territory opened at 8:00 local time on the 15th, and voting for the 2024 Russian presidential election officially began. Current Russian President Vladimir Putin, Slutsky from the Liberal Democratic Party of Russia, Kharitonov from the Communist Party of the Russian Federation and Davankov from the New People's Party of Russia will run for the next president.
According to the "Presidential Election Law of the Russian Federation", the president is the head of state of Russia and each term is 6 years. Any citizen of the Russian Federation who is over 35 years old, has lived in Russia for more than 25 years, and does not currently hold or have held the citizenship of any other country in the past can run for president. According to regulations, the counting of votes for the presidential election will begin after the polls close. The Russian Central Election Commission will confirm the final results of the election no later than March 28 and announce them within three days after confirmation.
input:
Official voting for the eighth presidential election of the Russian Federation will be held from March 15 to 17. According to "Russia Today" (RT), on March 15, the Kremlin Palace announced that Russian President Vladimir Putin will participate in the Russian presidential election online.
Russian President Vladimir Putin took part in voting in Russia's presidential election online. Source: RT video screenshot

In addition, RT quoted RIA News Agency as saying that on March 15, Medvedev, Vice Chairman of the Russian Federation Security Council, went to the polling station to vote in the Russian presidential election.
According to media reports, polling stations in Kamchatka Krai, Chukotka Autonomous Region and other places located in the easternmost part of Russian territory opened at 8:00 local time on the 15th, and voting for the 2024 Russian presidential election officially began. Current Russian President Vladimir Putin, Slutsky from the Liberal Democratic Party of Russia, Kharitonov from the Communist Party of the Russian Federation and Davankov from the New People's Party of Russia will run for the next president.
According to the "Presidential Election Law of the Russian Federation", the president is the head of state of Russia and each term is 6 years. Any citizen of the Russian Federation who is over 35 years old, has lived in Russia for more than 25 years, and does not currently hold or have held the citizenship of any other country in the past can run for president. According to regulations, the counting of votes for the presidential election will begin after the polls close. The Russian Central Election Commission will confirm the final results of the election no later than March 28 and announce them within three days after confirmation.

title: 俄罗斯大选2024·选民｜年轻的俄罗斯人怎么想？
content:
2024年3月15-17日，俄罗斯将举行总统选举，71岁的现任总统普京寻求第5次出任国家元首。此次大选是俄罗斯2020年通过宪法修正案后的首次总统大选，也是俄罗斯首次战时选举。
全俄社会舆论研究中心3月4日公布了最新民调结果，在1600名通过电话访谈接受民调的18岁以上俄罗斯公民中，70%的受访者表示肯定会参加投票，计划投票的选民中有75%的人表示将在大选中支持普京。随后，该中心于3月11日根据电话调查公布的估算结果显示，普京或将获得82%的选票。
2022年2月，普京采取“特别军事行动”。如今俄乌冲突已经持续两年多，战时状态下的俄罗斯人生活发生了巨大变化。虽然受到西方制裁，根据国际货币基金组织的数据，今年俄罗斯经济预计增长2.6%。与此同时，俄罗斯通货膨胀率将超过7%，但失业率仍然很低；去年10月，俄罗斯失业率自苏联解体后首次降到3%以下（2.9%）。
在竞选活动中，普京多次聚焦民生问题，承诺将在政府补贴下提供廉价抵押贷款，以帮助年轻家庭，特别是有孩子的家庭；此外，他还承诺在医疗、教育、科学、文化和体育领域投入更多政府资金，同时继续努力消除贫困。
对于冲突、选举和未来，年轻的俄罗斯人怎么想？澎湃新闻（www.thepaper.cn）和他们聊了聊。
“他让卢甘斯克的人们过上了更好的生活”
translation:
Russia will hold a presidential election on March 15-17, 2024. The 71-year-old current President Putin seeks to serve as head of state for the fifth time. This election is Russia’s first presidential election since the adoption of constitutional amendments in 2020, and it is also Russia’s first wartime election.
The All-Russian Public Opinion Research Center announced the latest poll results on March 4. Among 1,600 Russian citizens over the age of 18 who were polled through telephone interviews, 70% of the respondents said they would definitely participate in the vote. Voters who plan to vote 75% of people said they would support Putin in the general election. Subsequently, estimates released by the center on March 11 based on a telephone survey showed that Putin may receive 82% of the vote.
In February 2022, Putin took "special military action." Now that the conflict between Russia and Ukraine has lasted for more than two years, the lives of Russians during wartime have undergone tremendous changes. Despite Western sanctions, the Russian economy is expected to grow by 2.6% this year, according to the International Monetary Fund. At the same time, Russia's inflation rate will exceed 7%, but the unemployment rate remains low; last October, Russia's unemployment rate fell below 3% (2.9%) for the first time since the collapse of the Soviet Union.
During the election campaign, Putin repeatedly focused on people's livelihood issues, promising to provide cheap mortgage loans with government subsidies to help young families, especially families with children; in addition, he also promised to provide support in health care, education, science, culture and sports. to invest more government funds in areas while continuing efforts to eradicate poverty.
What do young Russians think about the conflict, elections and the future? The Paper (www.thepaper.cn) chatted with them.
"He gave people in Luhansk a better life"
input:

The All-Russian Public Opinion Research Center announced the latest poll results on March 4. Voters who plan to vote 75% of people said they would support Putin in the general election. Subsequently, estimates released by the center on March 11 based on a telephone survey showed that Putin may receive 82% of the vote.
In February 2022, Putin took "special military action." Now that the conflict between Russia and Ukraine has lasted for more than two years, the lives of Russians during wartime have undergone tremendous changes. Despite Western sanctions, the Russian economy is expected to grow by 2.6% this year, according to the International Monetary Fund. At the same time, Russia's inflation rate will exceed 7%, but the unemployment rate remains low; last October, Russia's unemployment rate fell below 3% (2.9%) for the first time since the collapse of the Soviet Union.
During the election campaign, Putin repeatedly focused on people's livelihood issues, promising to provide cheap mortgage loans with government subsidies to help young families, especially families with children; in addition, he also promised to provide support in health care, education, science, culture and sports. to invest more government funds in areas while continuing efforts to eradicate poverty.
What do young Russians think about the conflict, elections and the future? The Paper (www.thepaper.cn) chatted with them.
"He gave people in Luhansk a better life"

title: Итоги выборов президента: Победа Путина, второе место КПРФ, рекордная явка
content:
По итогам прошедших выборов Владимир Путин переизбран президентом России на шесть лет. По итогам обработки 100% протоколов УИК действующего главу государства поддержали 87,28% граждан. Явка побила рекорд, превысив 77%. На второе место вышел кандидат от КПРФ Николай Харитонов - у него 4,31%. При этом впервые в постсоветской истории коммунисты получили менее 10%.

К 15.00 понедельника обработаны 100% итоговых протоколов участковых избирательных комиссий. Подсчет голосов завершен. Согласно информационному табло на сайте ЦИК, места распределились так:

Владимир Путин (самовыдвижение) - 87,28%
Николай Харитонов (КПРФ) - 4,31%
Владислав Даванков ("Новые люди") - 3,85%
Леонид Слуцкий (ЛДПР) - 3,20%
Таким образом, действующий президент Владимир Путин переизбран на новый шестилетний срок полномочий (нынешний срок истекает 7 мая 2024 года). Напомним, он баллотировался в порядке самовыдвижения и при поддержке двух парламентских партий - "Единой России" и "Справедливой России".
translation:
Following the results of the last elections, Vladimir Putin was re-elected President of Russia for six years. Based on the results of processing 100% of the PEC protocols, the current head of state was supported by 87.28% of citizens. Turnout broke a record, exceeding 77%. The candidate from the Communist Party of the Russian Federation, Nikolai Kharitonov, came in second place with 4.31%. At the same time, for the first time in post-Soviet history, the Communists received less than 10%.

By 15:00 on Monday, 100% of the final protocols of precinct election commissions had been processed. The vote count is complete. According to the information board on the CEC website, the places were distributed as follows:

Vladimir Putin (self-nomination) - 87.28%
Nikolai Kharitonov (Communist Party of the Russian Federation) - 4.31%
Vladislav Davankov (“New People”) - 3.85%
Leonid Slutsky (LDPR) - 3.20%
Thus, current President Vladimir Putin was re-elected to a new six-year term of office (the current term expires on May 7, 2024). Let us remind you that he ran as a self-nominated candidate and with the support of two parliamentary parties - United Russia and A Just Russia.
input:
Following the results of the last elections, Vladimir Putin was re-elected President of Russia for six years. Based on the results of processing 100% of the PEC protocols, the current head of state was supported by 87.28% of citizens. Turnout broke a record, exceeding 77%. The candidate from the Communist Party of the Russian Federation, Nikolai Kharitonov, came in second place with 4.31%. At the same time, for the first time in post-Soviet history, the Communists received less than 10%.

By 15:00 on Monday, 100% of the final protocols of precinct election commissions had been processed. The vote count is complete. According to the information board on the CEC website, the places were distributed as follows:

Vladimir Putin (self-nomination) - 87.28%
Nikolai Kharitonov (Communist Party of the Russian Federation) - 4.31%
Vladislav Davankov (“New People”) - 3.85%
Leonid Slutsky (LDPR) - 3.20%
Thus, current President Vladimir Putin was re-elected to a new six-year term of office (the current term expires on May 7, 2024). Let us remind you that he ran as a self-nominated candidate and with the support of two parliamentary parties - United Russia and A Just Russia.

title: ЦИК объявил о победе Путина с 87% голосов
content:
МОСКВА, 17 мар (Рейтер) - Действующий президент России Владимир Путин побеждает на выборах главы государства с 87,17% голосов по итогам обработки 80,93% протоколов, свидетельствуют данные Центральной избирательной комиссии.

Явка на выборах составила 74,22% процента.

На втором месте идет кандидат от КПРФ Николай Харитонов с 4,22% голосов, на третьем - Владислав Даванков от «Новых людей» с 4,03%, на четвертом - Леонид Слуцкий от ЛДПР с 3,16%.

Опросы прочили Путину безоговорочную победу на пятых для него выборах.

Находящийся у власти почти четверть века Путин в ближайшие шесть лет обещает снизить уровень бедности, увеличить продолжительность жизни населения, нарастить несырьевой экспорт, повысить производительность труда и обеспечить рост инвестиций.

В марте он оценил свои инициативы на ближайшие шесть лет в 14 триллионов рублей.
translation:
MOSCOW, March 17 (Reuters) - Current Russian President Vladimir Putin wins the presidential election with 87.17% of the votes based on the results of processing 80.93% of the protocols, data from the Central Election Commission shows.

The turnout in the elections was 74.22% percent.

In second place is the candidate from the Communist Party of the Russian Federation Nikolai Kharitonov with 4.22% of the votes, in third is Vladislav Davankov from “New People” with 4.03%, in fourth is Leonid Slutsky from the Liberal Democratic Party with 3.16%.

Polls predicted an unconditional victory for Putin in his fifth election.

In power for almost a quarter of a century, Putin promises in the next six years to reduce poverty, increase life expectancy, increase non-resource exports, increase labor productivity and ensure growth in investment.

In March, he estimated his initiatives for the next six years at 14 trillion rubles.
input:
MOSCOW, March 17 (Reuters) - Current Russian President Vladimir Putin wins the presidential election with 87.17% of the votes based on the results of processing 80.93% of the protocols, data from the Central Election Commission shows.

The turnout in the elections was 74.22% percent.

In second place is the candidate from the Communist Party of the Russian Federation Nikolai Kharitonov with 4.22% of the votes, in third is Vladislav Davankov from “New People” with 4.03%, in fourth is Leonid Slutsky from the Liberal Democratic Party with 3.16%.

Polls predicted an unconditional victory for Putin in his fifth election.

In power for almost a quarter of a century, Putin promises in the next six years to reduce poverty, increase life expectancy, increase non-resource exports, increase labor productivity and ensure growth in investment.

In March, he estimated his initiatives for the next six years at 14 trillion rubles.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: Putin says Crimea ‘returned home’ when it was annexed and declares Donbas part of ‘New Russia’ – as it happened | Ukraine | The Guardian
content:
The war in Ukraine was front and centre in his victory speech, as Putin claimed he was securing the border from recent raids by pro-Ukrainian military units and said that his main tasks as president would be the war in Ukraine, “strengthening defence capacity and the military”. Asked about the potential for a direct conflict with Nato, he said: “I think that everything is possible in the modern world … everyone understands that this would be one step from a full-scale third world war. I don’t think that anyone is interested in that.”
Speaking in central Moscow after early results indicated he had won Russia’s presidential election in a landslide, Putin said unnamed people made an offer to release Alexei Navalny, the late Russian opposition leader, in a swap deal with the west a few days before he died. “The person who spoke to me hadn’t finished his sentence, and I said I agree. But, unfortunately, what happened, happened,” Putin said. It was the first time the Russian president had commented on Navalny since his death, which he called a “sad event”.
The Russian embassy in the US will send Washington a diplomatic note on Monday protesting against the actions of the secret service during Russia’s presidential election on Sunday, Tass state news agency reported. Citing Russia’s ambassador to the US, Anatoly Antonov, Tass reported that secret service officers “allowed blocking the entrance to the Russian embassy and creating obstacles for Russian citizens who came to vote”.
China will consider taking part in a peace conference aimed at ending the war in Ukraine which neutral Switzerland plans to host in the coming months, the Asian country’s ambassador to Berne was quoted as saying on Monday. Wang Shihting, China’s ambassador to Switzerland, said in an interview with the Neue Zuercher Zeitung that all parties should work to end the war. The Swiss government has said it aims to hold the peace conference by this summer after the idea was floated in January.
Ukraine’s air defence systems destroyed 17 out of 22 Russia-launched drones overnight, Ukraine’s air force has said. The air force wrote on Telegram that in addition to the attack drones, Russia also launched seven missiles at Ukraine.
Ukraine reported dozens of attacks by Russia near their shared border on Sunday, with more than 60 shelling incidents in the district of Sumy in which one person was killed. Earlier on Sunday one man was killed and at least eight people were wounded in a Russian missile attack on the Black Sea port city of Mykolaiv, Ukrainian officials said.
A drone strike at a military installation in Moldova’s breakaway republic of Transnistria on Sunday destroyed a helicopter and ignited a fire, authorities in the pro-Russia region said, blaming the strike on Ukraine. However, Moldova’s Bureau for Reintegration Policies said in a statement that after examining video footage, they “do not confirm any attack” on Transnistria and called it “an attempt to cause fear and panic in the region”. It added that the military equipment destroyed in the footage, which appeared across social media, “has not worked for several years”.

Asked about the potential for a direct conflict with Nato, he said: “I think that everything is possible in the modern world … everyone understands that this would be one step from a full-scale third world war. I don’t think that anyone is interested in that.”
Speaking in central Moscow after early results indicated he had won Russia’s presidential election in a landslide, Putin said unnamed people made an offer to release Alexei Navalny, the late Russian opposition leader, in a swap deal with the west a few days before he died. “The person who spoke to me hadn’t finished his sentence, and I said I agree. But, unfortunately, what happened, happened,” Putin said. It was the first time the Russian president had commented on Navalny since his death, which he called a “sad event”.
The Russian embassy in the US will send Washington a diplomatic note on Monday protesting against the actions of the secret service during Russia’s presidential election on Sunday, Tass state news agency reported. title: 华语智库:为什么普京能高票胜选连任俄总统？当天他给我国送来“超级大礼”！
content:
四是着力提升国防实力,构筑强大的卫国屏障。

俄罗斯独立后,接管了前苏联大部分军事力量。但是,由于时间相隔久远、加之俄独立之初经济滞后,一些编制体制和武器、装备跟不上现代战争的需要。

普京作为俄武装力量最高统帅,以战斗性能的提升为核心,着眼于军事改革和发展,及时顺理军队内部指挥体系,调整战略力量和常规力量的平衡,改造、更新老旧武器装备,增强各部队之间的协同作战能力,加大对部队实战化训练的投入,及时发布了俄2018-2028年军事装备发展纲要,对无人机智能武器、高超音速武器、数字化指挥系统的应用,提出了明确要求,并努力付诸实施。2012年,俄军现代化武器装备所占比例只有16%,到2021年底,这一比例达到了71.2%,如今现代化武器装备的比例提升至95%。

特别是近年来俄罗斯的高、精、尖武器不断研制成功,号称无限射程的“海燕”核动力战略巡航导弹和“波塞冬”核动力无人潜航器的测试即将完成。“萨尔马特”重型洲际弹道导弹已经交付部队。“先锋”高超音速洲际导弹和“佩列斯韦特”激光武器处在战备值班中。“匕首”高超音速导弹系统、“锆石”海基高超音速打击系统已经投入使用,普京曾自豪地说,“这些武器具有独一无二的特点”。

此外,拥有5900多枚核弹头的俄罗斯,目前一些战略核力量处于完全准备状态,国家安全保障能力明显提高,对美国和北约产生了有效的战略威慑力量。20多年来,无论俄罗斯如何战略举措和战斗行动,美西方国家都不敢对俄轻举妄动。
translation:
The fourth is to focus on improving national defense strength and building a strong defense barrier.

After Russia became independent, it took over most of the military power of the former Soviet Union. However, due to the long time difference and the economic lag at the beginning of Russia's independence, some establishment systems, weapons and equipment cannot keep up with the needs of modern warfare.

As the supreme commander of the Russian armed forces, Putin focuses on the improvement of combat performance, focuses on military reform and development, timely rationalizes the internal command system of the army, adjusts the balance of strategic and conventional forces, transforms and updates old weapons and equipment, and enhances various Collaborative combat capabilities among the troops, increased investment in actual combat training of the troops, timely released the Russian military equipment development outline for 2018-2028, and proposed the application of drone smart weapons, hypersonic weapons, and digital command systems. Make your requirements clear and work hard to implement them. In 2012, the proportion of modern weapons and equipment in the Russian army was only 16%. By the end of 2021, this proportion reached 71.2%, and now the proportion of modern weapons and equipment has increased to 95%.

In particular, Russia has been successfully developing high-end, sophisticated and cutting-edge weapons in recent years. The testing of the "Haiyan" nuclear-powered strategic cruise missile, which is said to have unlimited range, and the "Poseidon" nuclear-powered unmanned submarine are about to be completed. "Sarmat" heavy intercontinental ballistic missile has been delivered to the troops. "Avangard" hypersonic intercontinental missiles and "Peresvet" laser weapons are on combat readiness duty. The "Dagger" hypersonic missile system and the "Zircon" sea-based hypersonic strike system have been put into use. Putin once said proudly that "these weapons have unique characteristics."

In addition, Russia, which has more than 5,900 nuclear warheads, currently has some strategic nuclear forces in a state of full readiness, and its national security capabilities have been significantly improved, creating an effective strategic deterrent to the United States and NATO. For more than 20 years, no matter what Russia's strategic measures and combat operations are, the United States and Western countries have not dared to act rashly against Russia.

Make your requirements clear and work hard to implement them. In 2012, the proportion of modern weapons and equipment in the Russian army was only 16%. By the end of 2021, this proportion reached 71.2%, and now the proportion of modern weapons and equipment has increased to 95%.

In particular, Russia has been successfully developing high-end, sophisticated and cutting-edge weapons in recent years. The testing of the "Haiyan" nuclear-powered strategic cruise missile, which is said to have unlimited range, and the "Poseidon" nuclear-powered unmanned submarine are about to be completed. title: 俄大选最后一天：“中午反普京”行动引爆全球-环球大观-万维读者网（电脑版）
content:
现年71岁的普京1999年首度出任俄罗斯总统，如果他能把未来六年新的总统任期做完，那他在位时间不仅超越苏联时期的独裁者斯大林，而且成为俄罗斯过去200多年主政时间最长的领导人。
据法新社周日最新报道，在莫斯科的一些投票所外，周日中午许多人响应抗议呼吁排起长队。俄罗斯当局已经在十几个城市抓捕了至少74位抗议选举投票的俄罗斯人。
此次大选进行之际，普京以“特别军事行动”之名对邻国乌克兰无端发动的大规模侵略战争刚刚进入第三个年头。这是二战以来欧洲发生的最大规模、伤亡最惨重的一场战争。
路透社周日报道，就在俄罗斯民众走向投票所的三天里，俄乌两军的激烈交锋也如影随形。
俄罗斯周日称，乌克兰对俄罗斯广泛地区发动了35架无人机袭击，包括针对莫斯科，引发一个炼油厂发生大火，另外一些地区断电。
俄罗斯萨马拉州州长星期六表示，当地两家炼油厂遭到乌克兰无人机袭击并引发大火，但是没有造成人员伤亡。
同一天，俄罗斯别尔哥罗德州州长也对外表示，州府别尔哥罗德市当天遭到乌军部队的炮击，导致两人丧生，三人受伤。这位州长还在社媒上贴文说，由于来自乌克兰的袭击增多，州政府已经决定当地的购物中心在星期日和星期一两天不营业，学校也将在星期一二两天停课。
另据俄罗斯卫星通讯社的报道，克里姆林宫发言人德米特里·佩斯科夫（Dmitri Peskov）向记者表示，星期六凌晨乌克兰“破坏分子”数次尝试入侵俄罗斯别尔哥罗德州和库尔斯克州领土，但是2500名“破坏分子”中有1700人损失，包括550人丧生。
translation:
The 71-year-old Putin first became the president of Russia in 1999. If he can complete his new presidential term in the next six years, his reign will not only surpass Stalin, the dictator of the Soviet Union, but also become the longest ruler of Russia in the past 200 years. The longest leader.
According to the latest report from Agence France-Presse on Sunday, many people lined up in long lines outside some polling stations in Moscow at noon on Sunday in response to calls for protests. Russian authorities have arrested at least 74 Russians protesting against the electoral vote in more than a dozen cities.
At the time of this election, Putin's unprovoked large-scale aggressive war against neighboring Ukraine in the name of "special military operations" has just entered its third year. This is the largest war with the deadliest casualties in Europe since World War II.
Reuters reported on Sunday that in the three days as Russians went to the polls, fierce confrontations between the Russian and Ukrainian armies also followed.
Russia said on Sunday that Ukraine had launched 35 drone attacks across a wide range of Russia, including Moscow, causing a fire at an oil refinery and cutting power to other areas.
The governor of Russia's Samara region said on Saturday that two local oil refineries were attacked by Ukrainian drones and caused fires, but there were no casualties.
On the same day, the governor of Russia's Belgorod region also stated that the city of Belgorod, the state capital, was shelled by Ukrainian troops that day, killing two people and injuring three others. The governor also posted on social media that due to the increase in attacks from Ukraine, the state government has decided that local shopping malls will be closed on Sunday and Monday, and schools will also be closed on Monday and Tuesday.
According to a report from the Russian Satellite News Agency, Kremlin spokesman Dmitri Peskov told reporters that Ukrainian "saboteurs" made several attempts to invade Russia's Belgorod and Kursk regions early Saturday morning. territory, but 1,700 of the 2,500 "saboteurs" suffered losses, including 550 killed.

Russian authorities have arrested at least 74 Russians protesting against the electoral vote in more than a dozen cities.
At the time of this election, Putin's unprovoked large-scale aggressive war against neighboring Ukraine in the name of "special military operations" has just entered its third year. This is the largest war with the deadliest casualties in Europe since World War II.
Reuters reported on Sunday that in the three days as Russians went to the polls, fierce confrontations between the Russian and Ukrainian armies also followed.
Russia said on Sunday that Ukraine had launched 35 drone attacks across a wide range of Russia, including Moscow, causing a fire at an oil refinery and cutting power to other areas.
The governor of Russia's Samara region said on Saturday that two local oil refineries were attacked by Ukrainian drones and caused fires, but there were no casualties.
On the same day, the governor of Russia's Belgorod region also stated that the city of Belgorod, the state capital, was shelled by Ukrainian troops that day, killing two people and injuring three others. The governor also posted on social media that due to the increase in attacks from Ukraine, the state government has decided that local shopping malls will be closed on Sunday and Monday, and schools will also be closed on Monday and Tuesday.
According to a report from the Russian Satellite News Agency, Kremlin spokesman Dmitri Peskov told reporters that Ukrainian "saboteurs" made several attempts to invade Russia's Belgorod and Kursk regions early Saturday morning. territory, but 1,700 of the 2,500 "saboteurs" suffered losses, including 550 killed.

title: 胜选后,普京最新表态
content:
据央视新闻客户端消息,俄罗斯中央选举委员会公布的总统选举初步计票最新数据显示,截至目前已统计95%的选票；在四名候选人中,现任总统普京以87.32%的得票率大幅领先,实际已经赢得此次总统选举。
当地时间18日凌晨,俄罗斯总统普京召开记者会,感谢选民信任和支持,他将在新的任期继续推动国家发展。
当日,在谈及台湾问题时,普京表示“毫无疑问,台湾是中华人民共和国不可分割的一部分”,并称对中国“不友好者”试图拿台湾制造挑衅和实施制裁,注定会彻底失败。
在谈及中俄关系时,他表示俄中关系是国际关系中的稳定因素。
“我们两国的关系是在过去20年中逐步成型的,两国关系牢固并且互补,我相信这样的关系将继续保持下去。” 普京说,“最重要的是,我们的国家利益是一致的,这为解决我们的共同任务以及在国际关系领域创造了有利环境,俄罗斯和中国之间的关系（在国际关系中）是一个稳定因素。”
此外,谈及外交事务,普京表示,俄罗斯已经准备并愿意通过谈判和平解决俄乌冲突,但前提是基辅希望与俄罗斯建立友好睦邻关系,而不是获得时间重新武装遭受重创的乌克兰军队。
俄罗斯卫星通讯社提到,当被问及俄罗斯和北约之间是否有可能爆发全面冲突时,普京回答说,他认为当今世界“一切皆有可能”。
俄罗斯联邦第八届总统选举正式投票于15日至17日举行。俄罗斯中央选举委员会称,截至当地时间17日18时,全俄有74.4%的选民参加了投票。俄中央选举委员会将不晚于3月28日确认此次总统选举结果,并在选举结果确认后3日内予以公布。
translation:
According to CCTV News Client, the latest preliminary vote count data for the presidential election released by the Russian Central Election Commission shows that 95% of the votes have been counted so far; among the four candidates, current President Putin leads by a wide margin with 87.32% of the votes. has actually won this presidential election.
In the early morning of the 18th local time, Russian President Vladimir Putin held a press conference to thank voters for their trust and support. He will continue to promote national development in his new term.
On the same day, when talking about the Taiwan issue, Putin said that "there is no doubt that Taiwan is an inalienable part of the People's Republic of China." He also said that attempts by "unfriendly people" towards China to use Taiwan to create provocations and impose sanctions are destined to fail completely.
When talking about China-Russia relations, he said that Russia-China relations are a stabilizing factor in international relations.
"The relationship between our two countries has gradually taken shape over the past 20 years. The relationship between the two countries is strong and complementary. I believe that this relationship will continue to be maintained." Putin said, "The most important thing is that our national interests are consistent. "This creates a favorable environment for solving our common tasks and in the field of international relations, where relations between Russia and China are a stabilizing factor."
In addition, when it comes to foreign affairs, Putin said that Russia is ready and willing to peacefully resolve the Russian-Ukrainian conflict through negotiations, but the premise is that Kyiv hopes to establish friendly and good-neighborly relations with Russia, rather than gaining time to rearm the severely damaged Ukrainian army.
The Russian Satellite News Agency mentioned that when asked whether a full-scale conflict was possible between Russia and NATO, Putin replied that he believed "everything is possible" in today's world.
The official voting for the eighth presidential election of the Russian Federation will be held from the 15th to the 17th. The Russian Central Election Commission stated that as of 18:00 local time on the 17th, 74.4% of voters across Russia had participated in the voting. The Russian Central Election Commission will confirm the results of the presidential election no later than March 28 and announce them within three days after the election results are confirmed.

On the same day, when talking about the Taiwan issue, Putin said that "there is no doubt that Taiwan is an inalienable part of the People's Republic of China." He also said that attempts by "unfriendly people" towards China to use Taiwan to create provocations and impose sanctions are destined to fail completely.
When talking about China-Russia relations, he said that Russia-China relations are a stabilizing factor in international relations.
"The relationship between our two countries has gradually taken shape over the past 20 years. The relationship between the two countries is strong and complementary. I believe that this relationship will continue to be maintained." Putin said, "The most important thing is that our national interests are consistent. title: How does Putin stay in power? - National | Globalnews.ca
content:
When asked why Putin is holding an election at all, Braun said it’s because Putin “understands that he has a legitimacy crisis on his hands,” and that the Kremlin’s invasion of Ukraine was also part of shoring up support.
Russians will have to play along, Braun said, and pretend the election is real.
“If anyone disputes that, you will be eliminated physically or incarcerated or tortured,” he said.
By crushing dissent at home and waging war in Ukraine, Putin is ensuring no one can challenge him, Braun told Global News.
“What he’s trying to try to hammer home is basically a gangsters’ message, a mafia-like message. And that is. ‘You are helpless and resistance is hopeless. I have all the power.’”
On the surface, the election is contested. Three men are running against Putin for the presidency: Nikolai Kharitonov, a Communist; Leonid Slutsky, leader of the Liberal Democratic Party and a hard-line nationalist; and Vladislav Davankov from the New People Party.
McGill University Russia expert Maria Popova said who they are isn’t important.
“They’re there to give Putin the opportunity to lie to the West that there is choice within Russia,” she said, speaking from Montreal.
She said the results are already determined and any numbers that don’t conform will be changed, that ballots not for Putin will be destroyed or officials will claim they were faulty.
“There is a whole state machinery involved in producing this outcome,” she said. “In Russian, the word for ‘elections’ is choice, and it’s very ironic because, in fact, there is no choice.”
She said it’s hard to know how popular Putin is because the government controls the media.
Broadly speaking, most Russians seem to support Russia’s war in Ukraine, she noted, and he controls Russia’s security agency the FSB, heirs to the infamous Soviet KGB.
And the most serious threats to Putin’s rule are dead. Yevgeny Prigozhin, the leader of a Kremlin-backed mercenary group died in a plane crash last August after leading a mutiny against Putin.
input:

Russians will have to play along, Braun said, and pretend the election is real.
“If anyone disputes that, you will be eliminated physically or incarcerated or tortured,” he said.
By crushing dissent at home and waging war in Ukraine, Putin is ensuring no one can challenge him, Braun told Global News.
“What he’s trying to try to hammer home is basically a gangsters’ message, a mafia-like message. And that is. ‘You are helpless and resistance is hopeless. I have all the power.’”
On the surface, the election is contested. Three men are running against Putin for the presidency: Nikolai Kharitonov, a Communist; Leonid Slutsky, leader of the Liberal Democratic Party and a hard-line nationalist; and Vladislav Davankov from the New People Party.
McGill University Russia expert Maria Popova said who they are isn’t important.
“They’re there to give Putin the opportunity to lie to the West that there is choice within Russia,” she said, speaking from Montreal.
She said the results are already determined and any numbers that don’t conform will be changed, that ballots not for Putin will be destroyed or officials will claim they were faulty.
“There is a whole state machinery involved in producing this outcome,” she said. “In Russian, the word for ‘elections’ is choice, and it’s very ironic because, in fact, there is no choice.”
She said it’s hard to know how popular Putin is because the government controls the media.
Broadly speaking, most Russians seem to support Russia’s war in Ukraine, she noted, and he controls Russia’s security agency the FSB, heirs to the infamous Soviet KGB.
And the most serious threats to Putin’s rule are dead. Yevgeny Prigozhin, the leader of a Kremlin-backed mercenary group died in a plane crash last August after leading a mutiny against Putin.

title: 普京无悬念胜选 演说提与习近平友谊 | 德国之声 来自德国 介绍德国 | DW | 18.03.2024
content:
俄国反对派领袖纳瓦尔尼今年2月在狱中死亡。 他的遗孀尤利娅（Yulia Navalnaya）17日现身俄罗斯驻柏林使馆，在海外投下她的一票，现场有许多民众高呼她的名字表达支持。 尤利娅说，她也在选票上写下了纳瓦尔尼的名字。
据路透社报导，莫斯科、叶卡捷琳堡等地出现数百人甚至上千人的排队人龙，但难以确认他们是否都是为了抗议，或是这反映的是高投票率。克里姆林宫宣称，投票情况显示了俄罗斯民众对普京的信任以及对“乌克兰特别军事行动”的支持。
选举期间，反对派阵营发起了一系列抗议活动。多家通讯社周五报道称，多个投票站内发生了向投票箱倾倒染料，或纵火点燃票箱的事件。根据人权监督团体OVD-Info，18日俄国各地至少有80人因抗议被捕。周六，在叶卡捷琳堡，一名妇女正向投票箱倾倒绿色染料时被警方逮捕。俄罗斯过去曾多次发生过反对派人士被人泼洒绿色染料的事件，其中也包括纳瓦尔尼。
俄罗斯是世界上领土最大的国家，从最东端的勘察加半岛到最西边的飞地加里宁格勒，横跨11个时区，因此整个选举活动持续3天。
俄罗斯政府对抗议行动发出警告，并称可以看到“极端主义的苗头”。独立新闻平台Meduza发布的截图显示，一些在首都莫斯科的异议人士收到了内容如下的恐吓短信：“无论你是否支持极端主义组织，我们都欢迎你参加莫斯科的投票活动，但投票时，请保持镇定，不要排长队或做出其他挑衅。”是谁发出了这些短信，目前并不清楚。
translation:
Russian opposition leader Navalny died in prison in February this year. His widow, Yulia Navalnaya, appeared at the Russian Embassy in Berlin on the 17th to cast her vote overseas. Many people at the scene chanted her name to express support. Yulia said she also wrote Navalny's name on the ballot.
According to Reuters, hundreds or even thousands of people lined up in Moscow, Yekaterinburg and other places, but it is difficult to confirm whether they were all for protest or whether this reflected high turnout. The Kremlin claimed that the voting showed the Russian people's trust in Putin and their support for "special military operations in Ukraine."
During the election, the opposition camp launched a series of protests. Several news agencies reported on Friday that dye was poured into ballot boxes or set on fire at polling stations. According to the human rights monitoring group OVD-Info, at least 80 people were arrested across Russia on the 18th due to protests. A woman was arrested by police in Yekaterinburg on Saturday as she poured green dye into a ballot box. There have been many incidents in Russia in the past where opposition figures, including Navalny, were doused with green dye.
Russia is the largest country in the world, spanning 11 time zones from the Kamchatka Peninsula in the east to the exclave of Kaliningrad in the west, so the entire election event lasts for three days.
The Russian government warned of the protests, saying it could see "green shoots of extremism." Screenshots published by the independent news platform Meduza showed that some dissidents in the capital Moscow received threatening text messages with the following content: "Whether you support extremist organizations or not, you are welcome to participate in the voting activities in Moscow, but when voting, please remain calm , don’t stand in long lines or make other provocations.” It’s unclear who sent the messages.
input:
Russian opposition leader Navalny died in prison in February this year. His widow, Yulia Navalnaya, appeared at the Russian Embassy in Berlin on the 17th to cast her vote overseas. Many people at the scene chanted her name to express support. Yulia said she also wrote Navalny's name on the ballot.
According to Reuters, hundreds or even thousands of people lined up in Moscow, Yekaterinburg and other places, but it is difficult to confirm whether they were all for protest or whether this reflected high turnout. The Kremlin claimed that the voting showed the Russian people's trust in Putin and their support for "special military operations in Ukraine."
During the election, the opposition camp launched a series of protests. Several news agencies reported on Friday that dye was poured into ballot boxes or set on fire at polling stations. According to the human rights monitoring group OVD-Info, at least 80 people were arrested across Russia on the 18th due to protests. A woman was arrested by police in Yekaterinburg on Saturday as she poured green dye into a ballot box. There have been many incidents in Russia in the past where opposition figures, including Navalny, were doused with green dye.
Russia is the largest country in the world, spanning 11 time zones from the Kamchatka Peninsula in the east to the exclave of Kaliningrad in the west, so the entire election event lasts for three days.
The Russian government warned of the protests, saying it could see "green shoots of extremism." Screenshots published by the independent news platform Meduza showed that some dissidents in the capital Moscow received threatening text messages with the following content: "Whether you support extremist organizations or not, you are welcome to participate in the voting activities in Moscow, but when voting, please remain calm , don’t stand in long lines or make other provocations.” It’s unclear who sent the messages.

title: 习近平祝贺普京“连任”   中俄联手引发国际安全担忧 — 普通话主页
content:
俄罗斯总统普京在周末举行的大选投票中成功“连任”，而他的“老朋友”习近平也第一时间发去贺电。外界普遍认为，普京与已获得“三连任”的习近平会进一步加强中俄联盟。“威权”与“极权”联手，将对国际安全局势造成怎样的冲击？
备受世界关注的俄罗斯总统大选落下帷幕。据俄罗斯中央选举委员会当地时间3月18日发布的计票结果，现任总统普京（Vladimir Putin）以87.19%的得票率获得第五届任期，他对俄罗斯联邦长达24年的统治将再“续”6年。
国际社会批评普京连任 习近平第一时间发贺电
三年来俄乌战争仍陷入胶着，普京连任的结果一出，立即招致国际社会的批评与不满。乌克兰总统泽连斯基（Volodymyr Zelenskyy）在社交媒体平台X（前推特）上发视频表示，普京“为了维护自己的个人权力无所不用其极，世界上没有人能幸免于难。”他还指出，此次俄罗斯总统选举并不具有“合法性”。
然而，中国国家领导人习近平在第一时间致电普京，祝贺他当选连任俄罗斯联邦总统。习近平在贺电中表示：“你再次当选，充分体现了俄罗斯人民对你的支持。相信在你领导下，俄罗斯一定能够取得国家发展建设的更大成就。”另据俄媒“今日俄罗斯”（RT）报道，朝鲜最高领导人金正恩也向普京发出贺电。
在中国外交部本周一举行的例行记者会上，新任发言人林剑向普京连任表示祝贺。他说：“我们深信，在习近平主席和普京总统的战略引领下，中俄关系将持续向前发展。”
美国艾德菲大学文理学院院长、政治学教授王维正告诉本台：“（普京再度当选）让中国的主席习近平有抱团取暖的感觉，因为他们两个都在西方阵营以外。俄罗斯进攻乌克兰之前已经讲过两国关系是‘没有上限’，接下来很有可能两国会成为所谓的轴心国。”


2024年3月18日，普京在俄罗斯总统选举后，在莫斯科竞选总部发表讲话。（美联社）








上月，中方证实普京将于今年再度出访中国，这将是普京自掌权俄罗斯以来的第19次访华。
translation:
Russian President Vladimir Putin was successfully re-elected in the general election held over the weekend, and his "old friend" Xi Jinping also immediately sent a congratulatory message. It is generally believed that Putin and Xi Jinping, who has been reelected for three consecutive terms, will further strengthen the Sino-Russian alliance. What impact will the combination of "authoritarianism" and "totalitarianism" have on the international security situation?
The Russian presidential election, which has attracted worldwide attention, has come to an end. According to the vote counting results released by the Russian Central Election Commission on March 18, local time, current President Vladimir Putin won the fifth term with 87.19% of the vote. His 24-year rule over the Russian Federation will be "continued" "6 years.
The international community criticized Putin for his re-election; Xi Jinping immediately sent a congratulatory message
The Russia-Ukraine war is still in a stalemate three years ago, and Putin's re-election immediately attracted criticism and dissatisfaction from the international community. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said in a video on social media platform It was also pointed out that the Russian presidential election does not have "legitimacy".
However, Chinese leader Xi Jinping immediately called Putin to congratulate him on his re-election as President of the Russian Federation. Xi Jinping said in his congratulatory message: "Your re-election fully reflects the support of the Russian people for you. I believe that under your leadership, Russia will be able to achieve greater achievements in national development and construction." According to Russian media "Russia Today" (RT ) reported that North Korea’s supreme leader Kim Jong-un also sent a congratulatory message to Putin.
At a regular press conference held by the Chinese Ministry of Foreign Affairs on Monday, the new spokesperson Lin Jian congratulated Putin on his re-election. He said: "We are convinced that under the strategic guidance of President Xi Jinping and President Putin, China-Russia relations will continue to move forward."
Wang Weizheng, dean of the College of Arts and Sciences and professor of political science at Adelphi University in the United States, told this station: "(Putin's re-election) makes Chinese President Xi Jinping feel like they are united for warmth, because both of them are outside the Western camp. Russia had already attacked Ukraine before It has been said that the relationship between the two countries has 'no upper limit', and it is very likely that the two countries will become the so-called axis powers."


On March 18, 2024, Putin delivered a speech at the Moscow campaign headquarters after the Russian presidential election. (Associated Press)








Last month, China confirmed that Putin will visit China again this year. This will be Putin's 19th visit to China since taking power in Russia.

I believe that under your leadership, Russia will be able to achieve greater achievements in national development and construction." According to Russian media "Russia Today" (RT ) reported that North Korea’s supreme leader Kim Jong-un also sent a congratulatory message to Putin.
At a regular press conference held by the Chinese Ministry of Foreign Affairs on Monday, the new spokesperson Lin Jian congratulated Putin on his re-election. He said: "We are convinced that under the strategic guidance of President Xi Jinping and President Putin, China-Russia relations will continue to move forward."
Wang Weizheng, dean of the College of Arts and Sciences and professor of political science at Adelphi University in the United States, told this station: "(Putin's re-election) makes Chinese President Xi Jinping feel like they are united for warmth, because both of them are outside the Western camp. Russia had already attacked Ukraine before It has been said that the relationship between the two countries has 'no upper limit', and it is very likely that the two countries will become the so-called axis powers."


On March 18, 2024, Putin delivered a speech at the Moscow campaign headquarters after the Russian presidential election. (Associated Press)








Last month, China confirmed that Putin will visit China again this year. This will be Putin's 19th visit to China since taking power in Russia.

title: ﻿俄大选投票三天 普京支持率86% _大公网
content:
一名叫伊利亚的年轻人说：“我希望情况会变得更好，但如果选新人，他可能无法承担政府的重任。像普京这样经验丰富的人，能让国家即使在现在所处的困境中也能够有所发展。”“我当然支持我们的总统普京。”莫斯科市民叶甫根尼在投票后坦言。对于未来，这位年轻人表示，希望俄罗斯经济发展得越来越好，国民生活越来越红火。 
　　澳洲科廷大学副教授穆拉维耶夫表示，普京获得大量支持是“可以预见的”，他是俄罗斯的“危机管理者”，“俄罗斯人不愿意在战争进行期间看到（领导人）发生任何变动”。
　　俄对抗北约态势不变
　　分析指，在政治方面，去年普京平息了“瓦格纳”集团首领普里戈任的兵变危机，通过立法等各种手段加强社会管控，基本上维护了国家安全和社会稳定；在军事上，顶住了乌军去年下半年以来的反攻，随着美欧近期对基辅支援放缓，俄军目前在战场上占据上风；在经济领域，俄经济展现了很强的韧性，顶住了西方的疯狂制裁，去年GDP增长3.6%，高于全球平均水平的3%。
　　普京胜选几无悬念，之后俄罗斯与北约的军事对抗料将持续。伦敦国王学院战争研究系研究员米龙表示，普京将延续在国内和国际上的现行政策。在乌克兰战争方面，米龙称，从军事角度来看，尽管俄军特定部门的作用可能会进行一些调整，特别是黑海舰队，但总体战略没有任何变化的迹象。俄军可能会采取渐进的扩张领土方式，特别是在哈尔科夫等北部以及敖德萨等南部地区。
　　俄罗斯在囚反对派领袖纳瓦尔尼2月16日去世后，其支持者要求反对普京的选民17日中午前往各地投票站投票，包括投无效票、在选票写上“纳瓦尔尼”，或者把票投给另外三名候选人中的一人，以拉低普京的得票率。克里姆林宫此前表示，纳瓦尔尼盟友呼吁的任何行动都被视为挑衅，强调任何违法行径都将遭到警方取缔。
translation:
A young man named Ilya said: "I hope the situation will get better, but if a new person is elected, he may not be able to bear the heavy responsibilities of the government. An experienced person like Putin can make the country even in the current situation." Development can be achieved even in difficult situations. "Of course I support our President Putin," Moscow citizen Yevgeny said frankly after the vote. Regarding the future, the young man expressed his hope that the Russian economy will develop better and better and the national life will become more prosperous. 
Muraviev, an associate professor at Australia's Curtin University, said that Putin's massive support is "predictable" and that he is Russia's "crisis manager." "Russians are not willing to see anything happen to (the leader) while the war is going on. change".
Russia’s stance against NATO remains unchanged
Analysis points out that in terms of politics, last year Putin quelled the mutiny crisis of Prigozhin, the leader of the "Wagner" group, strengthened social control through legislation and other means, and basically maintained national security and social stability; in terms of military, he withstood the After the Ukrainian army's counteroffensive since the second half of last year, and with the recent slowdown in U.S. and European support for Kiev, the Russian army currently has the upper hand on the battlefield; in the economic field, the Russian economy has shown strong resilience and withstood the crazy sanctions of the West. , GDP growth last year was 3.6%, higher than the global average of 3%.
There is little doubt that Putin will win the election, and the military confrontation between Russia and NATO is expected to continue. Miron, a researcher at the Department of War Studies at King's College London, said Putin will continue his current policies domestically and internationally. Regarding the war in Ukraine, Miron said that from a military perspective, although there may be some adjustments to the roles of specific departments of the Russian military, especially the Black Sea Fleet, there are no signs of any change in the overall strategy. The Russian army may adopt a gradual approach to territorial expansion, especially in northern areas such as Kharkiv and southern areas such as Odessa.
After the death of Russian imprisoned opposition leader Navalny on February 16, his supporters asked voters who opposed Putin to go to the polling stations at noon on the 17th to vote, including casting an invalid vote, writing "Navalny" on the ballot, or putting "Navalny" on the ballot. vote for one of the other three candidates to lower Putin's vote share. The Kremlin has previously said that any action called by Navalny's allies would be considered a provocation, stressing that any illegal behavior would be clamped down by the police.

title: 俄总统与白俄罗斯总统通电话，讨论双边关系和国际局势等议题
content:
当地时间3月2日，克里姆林宫发布消息称，俄罗斯总统普京当天与白俄罗斯总统卢卡申科通电话，祝贺2月25日白俄罗斯成功举行议会和地方选举。
两国领导人详细讨论了在联盟和战略伙伴关系原则基础上，进一步发展俄白友好关系以及国际局势问题。
translation:
On March 2, local time, the Kremlin announced that Russian President Vladimir Putin had a phone call with Belarusian President Lukashenko that day to congratulate Belarus on the successful holding of parliamentary and local elections on February 25.
The leaders of the two countries discussed in detail the issues of further developing friendly relations between Russia and Belarus and the international situation on the basis of the principles of alliance and strategic partnership.
input:
On March 2, local time, the Kremlin announced that Russian President Vladimir Putin had a phone call with Belarusian President Lukashenko that day to congratulate Belarus on the successful holding of parliamentary and local elections on February 25.
The leaders of the two countries discussed in detail the issues of further developing friendly relations between Russia and Belarus and the international situation on the basis of the principles of alliance and strategic partnership.

title: 国际观察：普京胜选，俄罗斯发展有哪些看点
content:
据俄罗斯中央选举委员会当地时间18日凌晨发布的数据，在俄总统选举统计完成的85%选票中，现任总统普京以87.19%的得票率大幅领先其他候选人，实际已经赢得此次总统选举。
分析人士认为，普京连任后，俄内政外交将延续既有政策，包括着力加强技术自主，促进经济多元，积极发展与亚洲、非洲、中东和拉美等地区友好国家的关系，推动世界多极化发展。
获胜
俄罗斯第八届总统选举正式投票于15日至17日举行，共4位候选人参选，包括俄现任总统普京、俄自由民主党的斯卢茨基、俄联邦共产党的哈里托诺夫和俄新人党的达万科夫。
根据俄罗斯中央选举委员会数据，在俄总统选举统计完成的85%选票中，普京、哈里托诺夫、达万科夫、斯卢茨基分别获得87.19%、4.24%、3.99%、3.16%的选票。
根据俄总统选举规则，在选举中获得50％以上选票者当选总统，因此普京实际上已经赢得选举。俄中央选举委员会将不晚于3月28日确认此次总统选举结果，并在选举结果确认后3日内予以公布。
18日凌晨，普京在竞选总部发表讲话，感谢所有选民的支持。他说，俄罗斯将会进一步向前发展，变得更坚实、更强大、更高效。
技术自主，经济多元
俄经济在乌克兰危机升级初期遭遇震荡后，逐步展现出韧性。俄罗斯联邦国家统计局今年2月初发布的数据显示，2023年俄国内生产总值增长3.6%。但西方国家对俄在金融、投资、技术产品进口等领域的封锁给俄经济长远发展带来困难。如何继续对冲西方制裁影响是普京执政的一个任务。
普京在2月底向议会两院发表的国情咨文中表示，缺乏人才和自有先进技术不足等因素可能会导致经济增长减速。因此，国家将大力加强教育、科技等领域发展，让技术自主成为产业升级的动力，以提高俄经济的效率和竞争力。
他提出，到2030年，俄高技术产品和服务在本国市场所占份额应增加50%，非原料、非能源产品出口至少增加三分之二。俄罗斯应在涉及公民健康、粮食安全等领域拥有关键技术，并在机床、机器人、运输、无人驾驶、航空、海洋、数字经济、新材料和化学等能够促进经济可持续发展的领域实现技术自主，重点领域投资额应增长70%，至少再新建100个科技园区。
普京说，当前非资源产业在俄经济增长结构中所占的比重超过90%，俄经济正在变得更加多元化、更可持续。
俄国家杜马（议会下院）金融市场委员会主席阿克萨科夫说，俄经济逐渐适应西方制裁，并迅速发生变化。西方压迫促使俄罗斯大力推进经济内部重组，使其加速摆脱对资源依赖。
延续外交政策
俄专家认为，抵制西方围堵打压、团结友好国家、实现既定外交目标将成为普京今后外交政策的着力点。
普京曾表示，无论谁在2024年的美国总统选举中获胜，美国对俄外交政策都不太可能发生根本性变化，美方仍将视俄罗斯为敌。
俄政治信息中心主任穆欣表示，普京将继续对不友好国家采取强硬立场。俄罗斯国际事务理事会专家科尔图诺夫说，接下来一段时间，俄美将继续深度对抗，但双方仍将保持一定克制，以避免发生核战争等意外。
俄专家认为，普京将延续此前外交政策，积极发展与亚洲、非洲、中东和拉美等地区友好国家的关系，扩大朋友圈，加强在国际及区域组织中的影响力并推动世界多极化。
此外，有分析认为，普京今后将更加重视俄罗斯与其他金砖国家的关系，并将这种关系拓展到包括贸易在内的多个领域。穆欣认为，俄罗斯将继续在金砖合作机制和上合组织等框架内发挥重要作用。
translation:
According to data released by the Russian Central Election Commission in the early morning of the 18th local time, among the 85% of votes counted in the Russian presidential election, current President Putin led other candidates by a wide margin with 87.19% of the votes, and has actually won the presidential election.
Analysts believe that after Putin's re-election, Russia's domestic and foreign affairs will continue its existing policies, including focusing on strengthening technological independence, promoting economic diversification, actively developing relations with friendly countries in Asia, Africa, the Middle East and Latin America, and promoting the development of a multi-polar world. .
win
The official voting for Russia's eighth presidential election was held from the 15th to the 17th. A total of four candidates participated in the election, including the current Russian President Vladimir Putin, the Russian Liberal Democratic Party's Slutsky, the Russian Federation's Communist Party Kharitonov and the Russian newcomer Davankov of the party.
According to data from the Russian Central Election Commission, among the 85% of votes counted in the Russian presidential election, Putin, Kharitonov, Davankov, and Slutsky received 87.19%, 4.24%, 3.99%, and 3.16% of the votes respectively. .
According to Russian presidential election rules, the person who gets more than 50% of the votes in the election is elected president, so Putin has actually won the election. The Russian Central Election Commission will confirm the results of the presidential election no later than March 28 and announce them within 3 days after the election results are confirmed.
In the early morning of the 18th, Putin delivered a speech at the campaign headquarters, thanking all voters for their support. He said that Russia will move forward further and become more solid, stronger and more efficient.
Technical independence, economic diversification
After the Russian economy suffered shocks in the early stages of the escalation of the Ukraine crisis, it has gradually shown resilience. Data released by the Russian Federal State Statistics Service in early February this year show that Russia’s GDP will grow by 3.6% in 2023. However, Western countries' blockade of Russia in the fields of finance, investment, and technological product imports has brought difficulties to the long-term development of the Russian economy. How to continue to hedge against the impact of Western sanctions is a task for Putin's administration.
In his State of the Nation Address delivered to both houses of parliament at the end of February, Putin stated that factors such as a lack of talent and insufficient own advanced technology may lead to a slowdown in economic growth. Therefore, the country will vigorously strengthen the development of education, science and technology and other fields, and let technological independence become the driving force for industrial upgrading to improve the efficiency and competitiveness of the Russian economy.
He proposed that by 2030, the share of Russia's high-tech products and services in the domestic market should increase by 50%, and the export of non-raw materials and non-energy products should increase by at least two-thirds. Russia should possess key technologies in fields involving citizens' health and food security, and achieve technological independence in fields that can promote sustainable economic development, such as machine tools, robots, transportation, unmanned driving, aviation, oceans, digital economy, new materials and chemistry. , investment in key areas should increase by 70%, and at least 100 more science and technology parks should be built.
Putin said that non-resource industries currently account for more than 90% of Russia's economic growth structure, and the Russian economy is becoming more diversified and sustainable.
Aksakov, chairman of the Financial Markets Committee of the Russian State Duma (lower house of parliament), said that the Russian economy is gradually adapting to Western sanctions and is changing rapidly. Western oppression has prompted Russia to vigorously promote the internal restructuring of its economy and speed up its transition away from resource dependence.
continuation of foreign policy
Russian experts believe that resisting Western containment and suppression, uniting friendly countries, and achieving established diplomatic goals will become the focus of Putin's future foreign policy.
Putin has said that no matter who wins the U.S. presidential election in 2024, the U.S. foreign policy toward Russia is unlikely to undergo fundamental changes, and the U.S. will still regard Russia as an enemy.
Mukhin, director of the Russian Political Information Center, said that Putin will continue to take a tough stance against unfriendly countries. Kortunov, an expert at the Russian Council for International Affairs, said that in the coming period, Russia and the United States will continue to have in-depth confrontation, but both sides will still maintain a certain degree of restraint to avoid accidents such as nuclear war.
Russian experts believe that Putin will continue his previous foreign policy, actively develop relations with friendly countries in Asia, Africa, the Middle East and Latin America, expand his circle of friends, strengthen his influence in international and regional organizations, and promote world multipolarity.
In addition, some analysts believe that Putin will pay more attention to the relationship between Russia and other BRICS countries in the future and expand this relationship to multiple areas including trade. Mukhin believes that Russia will continue to play an important role within frameworks such as the BRICS cooperation mechanism and the Shanghai Cooperation Organization.
