He warned that if a direct conflict breaks out between NATO and Russia, it will be just one step away from world war.

title: Итоги выборов-2024: Путин побеждает с рекордными результатом и явкой в истории РФ
content:
Президентские выборы в России закончились. Действующий президент Владимир Путин побеждает с результатом более 87% голосов. Федеральная явка, с учетом дистанционного голосования, превысила 74%. Такие предварительные данные сообщает Центризбирком.

Первые результаты экзит-полов государственные социологические службы опубликовали в 21:00 по московскому времени — к этому часу все участки на территории России закрылись. Все экзит-полы показали убедительную победу Владимира Путина, который идет на пятый срок.

По итогам экзит-пола ВЦИОМ, Владимир Путин набрал 87% голосов. Экзит-пол ФОМ отдает ему даже больше — 87,8% голосов.

На предыдущих выборах, в 2018 году, Владимир Путин победил с итоговым результатом в 76,69%.

Второе место экзит-полы отдали кандидату от КПРФ, 75-летнему депутату Николаю Харитонову. По экзит-полу ВЦИОМа, он набрал 4,6% голосов (ФОМ отдал ему 4,7% голосов).

На третьем месте — вице-спикер Думы, кандидат от «Новых людей» Вячеслав Даванков. По данным ВЦИОМа, он набрал 4,2% голосов. ФОМ дает ему 3,6% от общего числа голосовавших.

Наконец, оба экзит-пола отдают последнее место главе ЛДПР Леониду Слуцкому. ВЦИОМ — 3% голосов, ФОМ — 2,5%.

Официальные итоги выборов подводит и ЦИК. К 3 часам ночи по Москве комиссия отчиталась об обработке более 90% протоколов. По этим предварительным результатам, Владимир Путин набрал 87,21% голосов, Харитонов — 4,28%, Даванков — 3,93%, а Слуцкий — 3,16%.
translation:
The presidential elections in Russia are over. Incumbent President Vladimir Putin wins with more than 87% of the vote. Federal turnout, including remote voting, exceeded 74%. These preliminary data are reported by the Central Election Commission.

State sociological services published the first results of exit polls at 21:00 Moscow time - by this hour all polling stations in Russia were closed. All exit polls showed a landslide victory for Vladimir Putin, who is running for a fifth term.

According to the results of the VTsIOM exit poll, Vladimir Putin received 87% of the votes. The FOM exit poll gives him even more - 87.8% of the votes.

In the previous elections, in 2018, Vladimir Putin won with a final result of 76.69%.

Exit polls gave second place to the candidate from the Communist Party of the Russian Federation, 75-year-old deputy Nikolai Kharitonov. According to the VTsIOM exit poll, he received 4.6% of the votes (FOM gave him 4.7% of the votes).

In third place is Deputy Speaker of the Duma, candidate from “New People” Vyacheslav Davankov. According to VTsIOM, he received 4.2% of the vote. FOM gives him 3.6% of the total number of voters.

Finally, both exit polls give the last place to the head of the LDPR, Leonid Slutsky. VTsIOM - 3% of votes, FOM - 2.5%.

The official results of the elections are also summed up by the Central Election Commission. By 3 a.m. Moscow time, the commission reported that more than 90% of the protocols had been processed. According to these preliminary results, Vladimir Putin received 87.21% of the votes, Kharitonov - 4.28%, Davankov - 3.93%, and Slutsky - 3.16%.
input:
The presidential elections in Russia are over. Incumbent President Vladimir Putin wins with more than 87% of the vote. Federal turnout, including remote voting, exceeded 74%. These preliminary data are reported by the Central Election Commission.

State sociological services published the first results of exit polls at 21:00 Moscow time - by this hour all polling stations in Russia were closed. All exit polls showed a landslide victory for Vladimir Putin, who is running for a fifth term.

According to the results of the VTsIOM exit poll, Vladimir Putin received 87% of the votes. The FOM exit poll gives him even more - 87.8% of the votes.

In the previous elections, in 2018, Vladimir Putin won with a final result of 76.69%.

Exit polls gave second place to the candidate from the Communist Party of the Russian Federation, 75-year-old deputy Nikolai Kharitonov. According to the VTsIOM exit poll, he received 4.6% of the votes (FOM gave him 4.7% of the votes).

In third place is Deputy Speaker of the Duma, candidate from “New People” Vyacheslav Davankov. According to VTsIOM, he received 4.2% of the vote. FOM gives him 3.6% of the total number of voters.

Finally, both exit polls give the last place to the head of the LDPR, Leonid Slutsky. VTsIOM - 3% of votes, FOM - 2.5%.

The official results of the elections are also summed up by the Central Election Commission. By 3 a.m. Moscow time, the commission reported that more than 90% of the protocols had been processed. According to these preliminary results, Vladimir Putin received 87.21% of the votes, Kharitonov - 4.28%, Davankov - 3.93%, and Slutsky - 3.16%.

title: Russia election: Putin basks in electoral victory even as Russians quietly protest | AP News
content:
Unusually, Putin referenced Navalny by name for the first time in years at the news conference. And he said he was informed of an idea to release the opposition leader from prison, days before his death. Putin said that he agreed to the idea, on condition that Navalny didn’t return to Russia.
Some Russians waiting to vote in Moscow and St. Petersburg told The Associated Press that they were taking part in the protest, but it wasn’t possible to confirm whether all of those in line were doing so.
One woman in Moscow, who said her name was Yulia, told the AP that she was voting for the first time.
“Even if my vote doesn’t change anything, my conscience will be clear ... for the future that I want to see for our country,” she said. Like others, she didn’t give her full name because of security concerns.
Another Moscow voter, who also identified himself only by his first name, Vadim, said he hoped for change, but added that “unfortunately, it’s unlikely.”
Meanwhile, supporters of Navalny streamed to his grave in Moscow, some bringing ballots with his name written on them.
Meduza, Russia’s biggest independent news outlet, published photos of ballots it received from their readers, with “killer” inscribed on one, “thief” on another and “The Hague awaits you” on yet another. The last refers to an arrest warrant for Putin from the International Criminal Court that accuses him of personal responsibility for abductions of children from Ukraine.
Some people told the AP that they were happy to vote for Putin — unsurprising in a country where independent media have been hobbled, state TV airs a drumbeat of praise for the Russian leader and voicing any other opinion is risky.
Dmitry Sergienko, who cast his ballot in Moscow, said, “I am happy with everything and want everything to continue as it is now.”
Voting took place over three days at polling stations across the vast country, in illegally annexed regions of Ukraine and online. As people voted Sunday, Russian authorities said Ukraine launched a massive new wave of attacks on Russia, killing two people — underscoring the challenges facing the Kremlin.
Despite tight controls, several dozen cases of vandalism at polling stations were reported across the voting period.
input:
Unusually, Putin referenced Navalny by name for the first time in years at the news conference. And he said he was informed of an idea to release the opposition leader from prison, days before his death. Putin said that he agreed to the idea, on condition that Navalny didn’t return to Russia.
Some Russians waiting to vote in Moscow and St. Petersburg told The Associated Press that they were taking part in the protest, but it wasn’t possible to confirm whether all of those in line were doing so.
One woman in Moscow, who said her name was Yulia, told the AP that she was voting for the first time.
“Even if my vote doesn’t change anything, my conscience will be clear ... for the future that I want to see for our country,” she said. Like others, she didn’t give her full name because of security concerns.
Another Moscow voter, who also identified himself only by his first name, Vadim, said he hoped for change, but added that “unfortunately, it’s unlikely.”
Meanwhile, supporters of Navalny streamed to his grave in Moscow, some bringing ballots with his name written on them.
Meduza, Russia’s biggest independent news outlet, published photos of ballots it received from their readers, with “killer” inscribed on one, “thief” on another and “The Hague awaits you” on yet another. The last refers to an arrest warrant for Putin from the International Criminal Court that accuses him of personal responsibility for abductions of children from Ukraine.
Some people told the AP that they were happy to vote for Putin — unsurprising in a country where independent media have been hobbled, state TV airs a drumbeat of praise for the Russian leader and voicing any other opinion is risky.
Dmitry Sergienko, who cast his ballot in Moscow, said, “I am happy with everything and want everything to continue as it is now.”
Voting took place over three days at polling stations across the vast country, in illegally annexed regions of Ukraine and online. As people voted Sunday, Russian authorities said Ukraine launched a massive new wave of attacks on Russia, killing two people — underscoring the challenges facing the Kremlin.
Despite tight controls, several dozen cases of vandalism at polling stations were reported across the voting period.

title: Выборы президента России. Главное
content:
Как проходит голосование за рубежом
Участки для голосования открыты в 144 странах, но единого графика работы у них нет. В некоторых странах в этот раз открылось меньше участков, чем на президентских выборах 2018 года. Это связано с сокращением числа дипломатов и консульских учреждений. Так, в Германии вместо 15 участков будет работать два (в посольстве в Берлине и в консульстве в Бонне), приводил пример член ЦИК Николай Булаев.

Власти Латвии предупредили, что будут проверять документы о праве нахождения в стране у россиян, которые придут голосовать в посольство в Риге. Власти соседней Эстонии заявили, что делать подобное не намерены.

К 13 марта, по данным МИДа, досрочно проголосовали 40 тыс. человек.
translation:
How does voting work abroad?
Polling stations are open in 144 countries, but they do not have uniform opening hours. In some countries, fewer polling stations have opened this time than in the 2018 presidential elections. This is due to a reduction in the number of diplomats and consular offices. So, in Germany, instead of 15 polling stations, there will be two (at the embassy in Berlin and the consulate in Bonn), CEC member Nikolai Bulaev gave an example.

The Latvian authorities warned that they will check the documents confirming the right to stay in the country of Russians who come to vote at the embassy in Riga. The authorities of neighboring Estonia stated that they do not intend to do this.

By March 13, according to the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, 40 thousand people voted early.
input:
How does voting work abroad?
Polling stations are open in 144 countries, but they do not have uniform opening hours. In some countries, fewer polling stations have opened this time than in the 2018 presidential elections. This is due to a reduction in the number of diplomats and consular offices. So, in Germany, instead of 15 polling stations, there will be two (at the embassy in Berlin and the consulate in Bonn), CEC member Nikolai Bulaev gave an example.

The Latvian authorities warned that they will check the documents confirming the right to stay in the country of Russians who come to vote at the embassy in Riga. The authorities of neighboring Estonia stated that they do not intend to do this.

By March 13, according to the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, 40 thousand people voted early.

title: Путин набрал 87,28 процента голосов на выборах
content:
МОСКВА, 18 мар — РИА Новости. Владимир Путин набрал 87,28% голосов на выборах президента по итогам обработки 100% протоколов, следует из данных ЦИК.
Второе место занял Николай Харитонов (КПРФ) с 4,31% голосов избирателей. Владислав Даванков ("Новые люди") набрал 3,85%, Леонид Слуцкий (ЛДПР) — 3,20%.
translation:
MOSCOW, March 18 – RIA Novosti. Vladimir Putin won 87.28% of the votes in the presidential election based on the results of processing 100% of the protocols, according to the CEC data.
Nikolai Kharitonov (Communist Party of the Russian Federation) took second place with 4.31% of the votes. Vladislav Davankov (New People) scored 3.85%, Leonid Slutsky (LDPR) - 3.20%.
input:
MOSCOW, March 18 – RIA Novosti. Vladimir Putin won 87.28% of the votes in the presidential election based on the results of processing 100% of the protocols, according to the CEC data.
Nikolai Kharitonov (Communist Party of the Russian Federation) took second place with 4.31% of the votes. Vladislav Davankov (New People) scored 3.85%, Leonid Slutsky (LDPR) - 3.20%.

title: Выборы президента России. Главное
content:
Кто следит за нарушениями
На выборах организовано видеонаблюдение на участковых и территориальных избирательных комиссиях. Трансляция с камер идет на служебный портал, доступ к которому есть у избирательных комиссий всех уровней, представителей зарегистрированных кандидатов и партий, их выдвинувших, наблюдателей от общественных палат, уполномоченного по правам человека, представителей Совета по правам человека, Минцифры.

Следить за ходом голосования также будут наблюдатели от кандидатов, представители российских общественных организаций, международные наблюдатели. Объявленные иностранными агентами граждане и организации следить за ходом голосования не имеют права; в частности, на участках не будет наблюдателей от движения «Голос» (внесен в реестр иноагентов в 2021 году).

На выборы не пригласили наблюдателей от Бюро по демократическим институтам и правам человека ОБСЕ. МИД заявил, что организация пристрастна и политизирована в своих оценках. «Отсутствие представителей БДИПЧ ОБСЕ никак не повлияет на качество международного наблюдения», — заверил МИД, так как приглашены более тысячи международных наблюдателей почти из ста иностранных государств и разных международных организаций. В частности, будут наблюдательные миссии от Содружества независимых государств, Шанхайской организации сотрудничества.
translation:
Who monitors violations
During the elections, video surveillance was organized at precinct and territorial election commissions. The broadcast from the cameras goes to a service portal, access to which is available to election commissions of all levels, representatives of registered candidates and parties that nominated them, observers from public chambers, the Commissioner for Human Rights, representatives of the Human Rights Council, and the Ministry of Digital Development.

Observers from candidates, representatives of Russian public organizations, and international observers will also monitor the voting process. Citizens and organizations declared to be foreign agents do not have the right to monitor the voting process; in particular, there will be no observers from the “Voice” movement at the polling stations (included in the register of foreign agents in 2021).

Observers from the OSCE Office for Democratic Institutions and Human Rights were not invited to the elections. The Foreign Ministry stated that the organization is biased and politicized in its assessments. “The absence of OSCE/ODIHR representatives will not in any way affect the quality of international observation,” the Foreign Ministry assured, since more than a thousand international observers from almost a hundred foreign states and various international organizations have been invited. In particular, there will be observation missions from the Commonwealth of Independent States and the Shanghai Cooperation Organization.
input:
Who monitors violations
During the elections, video surveillance was organized at precinct and territorial election commissions. The broadcast from the cameras goes to a service portal, access to which is available to election commissions of all levels, representatives of registered candidates and parties that nominated them, observers from public chambers, the Commissioner for Human Rights, representatives of the Human Rights Council, and the Ministry of Digital Development.

Observers from candidates, representatives of Russian public organizations, and international observers will also monitor the voting process. Citizens and organizations declared to be foreign agents do not have the right to monitor the voting process; in particular, there will be no observers from the “Voice” movement at the polling stations (included in the register of foreign agents in 2021).

Observers from the OSCE Office for Democratic Institutions and Human Rights were not invited to the elections. The Foreign Ministry stated that the organization is biased and politicized in its assessments. “The absence of OSCE/ODIHR representatives will not in any way affect the quality of international observation,” the Foreign Ministry assured, since more than a thousand international observers from almost a hundred foreign states and various international organizations have been invited. In particular, there will be observation missions from the Commonwealth of Independent States and the Shanghai Cooperation Organization.

title: 俄罗斯大选2024·特写｜堡垒、新领土和“变得更像俄罗斯”的小村庄
content:
今年38岁的莫斯科人尼基塔曾是一名跨国金融公司的资深白领。俄乌冲突爆发后，他成了同龄和同圈子人群中的“逆行者”。
2022年开春，尼基塔看到周围工作环境的动荡。很多年轻的同事们想要另谋出路：他们有的尝试跳槽去俄罗斯本土公司；有的继续留下；还有的试图出国，即使不能一步到位去西欧，也可以先辗转到黑山、土耳其等国家，之后再制定新的计划。
但这几条路对尼基塔没有什么特别的吸引力，莫斯科CBD的钢筋水泥丛林已使他心生厌倦。早在战前，他就心心念念到乡下去长住，2022年燃起的战火使他下定了最后的决心。看到大家各自筹划前路，他没有多想，出发前连家人都没告知。
“那时每天都被媒体和‘电报’频道里的信息轰炸，后来部分动员的消息也搞得人心惶惶。我想着去乡下还能图个清净，于是没和任何人商量，辞了职抓起行囊就走了。”
translation:
Nikita, a 38-year-old Moscow native, was once a senior white-collar worker in a multinational financial company. After the conflict between Russia and Ukraine broke out, he became a "rebel" among people of his age and in the same circle.
At the beginning of spring 2022, Nikita saw the turmoil in the surrounding work environment. Many young colleagues want to find another way out: some of them try to change jobs to local companies in Russia; some continue to stay; and some try to go abroad. Even if they cannot go to Western Europe in one step, they can first move to Montenegro, Turkey and other countries , and then make new plans.
But these roads have no special appeal to Nikita. He is tired of the reinforced concrete jungle in Moscow's CBD. As early as before the war, he had longed to live in the countryside for a long time. The war that broke out in 2022 made him make his final determination. Seeing everyone planning their own way forward, he didn't think much about it and didn't even inform his family before setting off.
"At that time, I was bombarded with information from the media and the Telegram channel every day. Later, the news of partial mobilization also made people panic. I thought that I could be clean by going to the countryside, so I resigned from my job without discussing it with anyone. The luggage is gone.”
input:
Nikita, a 38-year-old Moscow native, was once a senior white-collar worker in a multinational financial company. After the conflict between Russia and Ukraine broke out, he became a "rebel" among people of his age and in the same circle.
At the beginning of spring 2022, Nikita saw the turmoil in the surrounding work environment. Many young colleagues want to find another way out: some of them try to change jobs to local companies in Russia; some continue to stay; and some try to go abroad. Even if they cannot go to Western Europe in one step, they can first move to Montenegro, Turkey and other countries , and then make new plans.
But these roads have no special appeal to Nikita. He is tired of the reinforced concrete jungle in Moscow's CBD. As early as before the war, he had longed to live in the countryside for a long time. The war that broke out in 2022 made him make his final determination. Seeing everyone planning their own way forward, he didn't think much about it and didn't even inform his family before setting off.
"At that time, I was bombarded with information from the media and the Telegram channel every day. Later, the news of partial mobilization also made people panic. I thought that I could be clean by going to the countryside, so I resigned from my job without discussing it with anyone. The luggage is gone.”

title: 习近平电贺普京“当选连任”，传北京考虑参加瑞士举行的乌克兰和会
content:
我们深信在习近平主席和普京总统的战略引领下，中俄关系将持续向前发展，”中国外交部新任发言人林剑在星期一举行的例行记者会上表示。
尽管中国在俄罗斯入侵乌克兰遭到西方严厉制裁后，一直默默在向俄罗斯提供外交支持和经济协助，但是北京当局也不忘高调呼吁在乌克兰“停火止战”。中国政府欧亚事务特别代表李辉曾经两次出访俄罗斯和乌克兰以及欧洲多国，号称为和平穿针引线。

但是，由于中方的和平建议并未涉及俄罗斯从乌克兰被占领土撤军这一关键的诉求，因此基辅及其西方盟友并不特别看好北京的斡旋努力。

中国驻瑞士大使王世廷星期一在接受瑞士媒体采访时表示，北京正在考虑参与瑞士为结束乌克兰战争而将在几个月后举办的一场和平会议。

“必须防止危机进一步恶化甚至失控，”路透社引述王世廷的话说。“我们密切关注瑞士即将举办的乌克兰会议，并且在检视参与的可能性。”

瑞士政府今年1月首次提出主办乌克兰和会的想法，按照目前的进展，会议很可能在今年夏天举行。

由于瑞士政府并未计划邀请莫斯科与会，克里姆林宫便声称这一会议“毫无意义”，而且没有俄罗斯的参与一定失败。

瑞士总统维奥拉·阿姆赫德（Viola Amherd）上个月曾经表示，她怀疑和谈一开始就会让俄罗斯参加。

王世廷在接受媒体采访时表示，中国为政治解决乌克兰冲突提出了一项战略。

“所有国家的领土主权都必须得到尊重，而且联合国宪章也必须坚持，”他说。

“我们应该支持俄罗斯和乌克兰尽快恢复直接对话，以便让局势逐渐降温，”王世廷又说。
translation:
We are convinced that under the strategic guidance of President Xi Jinping and President Putin, China-Russia relations will continue to move forward," Lin Jian, the new spokesperson of the Chinese Ministry of Foreign Affairs, said at a regular press conference on Monday.
Although China has been quietly providing diplomatic support and economic assistance to Russia after Russia's invasion of Ukraine was severely sanctioned by the West, the Beijing authorities have not forgotten to make high-profile calls for a "ceasefire and an end to the war" in Ukraine. Li Hui, the Chinese government's special representative for Eurasian affairs, has visited Russia, Ukraine and many European countries twice, claiming to be a thread for peace.

However, because China's peace proposal does not address the key demand of Russia's withdrawal from occupied Ukrainian territories, Kyiv and its Western allies are not particularly optimistic about Beijing's mediation efforts.

China's ambassador to Switzerland Wang Shiting said in an interview with Swiss media on Monday that Beijing was considering participating in a peace conference that Switzerland will host in a few months to end the war in Ukraine.

"We must prevent the crisis from worsening or even getting out of control," Reuters quoted Wang Shiting as saying. “We are closely following the upcoming Ukraine conference in Switzerland and are examining the possibility of participating.”

The Swiss government first proposed the idea of ​​hosting the Ukraine peace conference in January this year. Based on current progress, the conference is likely to be held this summer.

Since the Swiss government did not plan to invite Moscow to the meeting, the Kremlin claimed that the meeting was "meaningless" and would definitely fail without Russia's participation.

Swiss President Viola Amherd said last month that she doubted Russia would be included in peace talks from the start.

Wang Shiting said in an interview with the media that China has proposed a strategy for a political settlement of the Ukrainian conflict.

"The territorial sovereignty of all countries must be respected and the United Nations Charter must be upheld," he said.

"We should support Russia and Ukraine in resuming direct dialogue as soon as possible so that the situation can gradually cool down," Wang Shiting added.
input:
We are convinced that under the strategic guidance of President Xi Jinping and President Putin, China-Russia relations will continue to move forward," Lin Jian, the new spokesperson of the Chinese Ministry of Foreign Affairs, said at a regular press conference on Monday.
Although China has been quietly providing diplomatic support and economic assistance to Russia after Russia's invasion of Ukraine was severely sanctioned by the West, the Beijing authorities have not forgotten to make high-profile calls for a "ceasefire and an end to the war" in Ukraine. Li Hui, the Chinese government's special representative for Eurasian affairs, has visited Russia, Ukraine and many European countries twice, claiming to be a thread for peace.

However, because China's peace proposal does not address the key demand of Russia's withdrawal from occupied Ukrainian territories, Kyiv and its Western allies are not particularly optimistic about Beijing's mediation efforts.

China's ambassador to Switzerland Wang Shiting said in an interview with Swiss media on Monday that Beijing was considering participating in a peace conference that Switzerland will host in a few months to end the war in Ukraine.

"We must prevent the crisis from worsening or even getting out of control," Reuters quoted Wang Shiting as saying. “We are closely following the upcoming Ukraine conference in Switzerland and are examining the possibility of participating.”

The Swiss government first proposed the idea of ​​hosting the Ukraine peace conference in January this year. Based on current progress, the conference is likely to be held this summer.

Since the Swiss government did not plan to invite Moscow to the meeting, the Kremlin claimed that the meeting was "meaningless" and would definitely fail without Russia's participation.

Swiss President Viola Amherd said last month that she doubted Russia would be included in peace talks from the start.

Wang Shiting said in an interview with the media that China has proposed a strategy for a political settlement of the Ukrainian conflict.

"The territorial sovereignty of all countries must be respected and the United Nations Charter must be upheld," he said.

"We should support Russia and Ukraine in resuming direct dialogue as soon as possible so that the situation can gradually cool down," Wang Shiting added.

title: 俄罗斯大选在即，“除了普京还有谁”的思维在弥漫 - BBC News 中文
content:
克里姆林宫对面的一个展览大厅里，普京（Vladimir Putin）走上舞台。
台下观众群起而立，掌声如雷。
受邀嘉宾不乏俄罗斯名人，他们支持普京参加三月份的总统选举，竞逐第五个任期。这里的观众都非常高兴。
“（普京）是一位非凡的领导人，是最有勇气和智慧的人。”电影导演安德里·康查罗夫斯基（Andrei Konchalovsky）欣喜地说。
“俄罗斯人民从未如此团结地支持他们的总统。”国家级歌手纳德日达·巴布基纳（Nadezhda Babkina）说，“任何试图阻止这一切的人都将失败。”
这次活动和一众名人高调表达支持，似乎是要表明候选人普京有自己的组织：普京超级联赛。
但要留意，这是一个由他创建和掌管的联赛。俄罗斯的政治制度就是普京的政治制度，他的游戏规则，是他的选举。
普京最尖锐的批评者早被“降级”，不是流亡海外，就是身陷囹圄。
因此，这里的选举很容易预测。
但情况并非总是如此。
30年前，我还记得在莫斯科观看俄罗斯电视台首次播出的选举之夜节目——那是一次议会选举，没有人知道谁会获胜。
我永远不会忘记他们请来占星家做政治预测。那其实很恰当，因为30年前，俄罗斯人眼中闪烁着关于民主、自由和国家未来的星辰。
对于今天的俄罗斯选举，你不需要占星家或水晶球。我现在就可以告诉你2024年总统大选的结果：普京大获全胜。
为何如此自信？
首先，尽管普京不会是选票上的唯一名字，但挑战者将不会有其宿敌，包括被监禁的反对党领袖纳瓦尔尼（Alexei Navalny）。普京对阵纳瓦尔尼？这在普京超级联赛中是不允许出现的。
诚然，另一位克里姆林宫的批评者纳德兹丁（Boris Nadezhdin）也力争参加投票。但纳德兹丁并非纳瓦尔尼，他针对普京的批评小心翼翼，据信在总统府内部也有关系。
如果他最终参选，将是因为克里姆林宫认为有一位具批评性的挑战者符合普京利益。
其次，在俄罗斯政府控制着电视台。普京获得大量的播放时间，他在电视上备受赞誉，很少被批评：这对寻求连任的人来说很方便。
translation:
In an exhibition hall opposite the Kremlin, Vladimir Putin took to the stage.
The audience stood up and applauded like thunder.
The invited guests include many Russian celebrities who support Putin's bid for a fifth term in March's presidential election. The audience here is very happy.
"(Putin) is an extraordinary leader, the most courageous and wise man." Film director Andrei Konchalovsky said happily.
"The Russian people have never been so united in supporting their president," said national singer Nadezhda Babkina. "Anyone who tries to stop this will fail."
The event, and the high-profile expressions of support from celebrities, seemed to be an attempt to show that candidate Putin has his own organization: the Putin Super League.
But be aware, this is a league he founded and runs. Russia's political system is Putin's political system, and his rules of the game are his elections.
Putin's sharpest critics have long since been "downgraded" and either exiled abroad or imprisoned.
Therefore, elections here are easy to predict.
But this is not always the case.
Thirty years ago, I remember watching the first election night broadcast on Russian television in Moscow - it was a parliamentary election and no one knew who was going to win.
I will never forget when they brought in astrologers to make political predictions. That's actually appropriate, because 30 years ago, Russians had stars shining in their eyes about democracy, freedom and the future of their country.
For today's Russian election, you don't need an astrologer or a crystal ball. I can tell you the results of the 2024 presidential election right now: Putin won a resounding victory.
Why so confident?
First, while Putin will not be the only name on the ballot, the challenger will not have his old enemies, including jailed opposition leader Alexei Navalny. Putin versus Navalny? This is not allowed in the Putin Super League.
True, another Kremlin critic, Boris Nadezhdin, is also pushing for a vote. But Naderzdin is not Navalny, he is careful about his criticism of Putin and is believed to have connections within the presidential palace.
If he ends up running, it will be because the Kremlin believes it is in Putin's interest to have a critical challenger.
Secondly, in Russia the government controls television stations. Putin gets a lot of air time, and he is praised on television and rarely criticized: convenient for those seeking re-election.

title: 俄罗斯大选2024·现场｜战时选举的低调氛围与稳步推进的政治进程
content:
有趣的是，在不抱希望地又一次“闯入”米秋林大街设在公立艺术培训机构的投票点后，保安面对我们理直气壮的“好奇，想看看咋搞的”要求，找了两三个领导请示，最后竟然答应放行。投票站内部布置相当简单，腾出一间教室放了贴有4名候选人的高台供人填写表格，3台电子投票器全部黑屏并没有工作，再往前就是一排长桌，背后坐了好几个选举委员会的工作人员和监督员。短暂驻足期间，前来投票的民众三三两两，不大的房间内算上工作人员、保安、站着的领导还有我们这两个格格不入的“好奇宝宝”，人数远远碾压了投票的选民。投票站的内部场景其实和12年前变化不大，今日总算不虚此行，欣然离去。临走前保安看着我们俩满足的样子感到好笑，没忍住来了一句“还喜欢不（Понравилось）？”
投票站入口的选举宣传海报

另一个与12年前的显著区别在于，这次投票的宣传低调，政治氛围不再浓厚。除了路边站点的各类广告外，似乎感受不到正在大选的氛围。由于线上投票更加普及，线下的站点继续减少，莫斯科大学主楼的站点也不再设置。科技给选举带来怎样的改变仍有待考察，然而一人一票塞进投票箱的仪式感无可替代。
在大选开启的同一天，莫斯科市的宣传重心也同时被其他文化活动所分散，颇有“百花齐放”之感。比如本周也是东正教大斋前盛大的民俗节日“谢肉节”，莫斯科市内设了多个不同主题的集市小摊，售卖节日必备美食“薄饼”、稻草人和各类手工艺品，还排满了丰富的节目单。本打算直奔投票站的我们，中途也不免被花样繁多的活动绊住了步伐，一连逛了三个设在不同城市景点附近的节日集市。
莫斯科市中心盛大的“谢肉节”集市舞台

红场的“回归纪念”活动与俄乌冲突的影子
出乎意料的是，本以为会成为选举投票造势重点区域的红场，其实在为大选结束后即将举行的另一项政治活动进行紧锣密鼓的筹备。全场各处搭建起了巨大的展板和舞台，印刷着欢迎克里米亚“回归祖国”10周年的活动宣传标志，圣瓦西里大教堂门口也被舞台设备遮挡无法靠近，游客只能隔着硕大的展板和“彩色洋葱头”合影留念。
红场上的下一个活动筹备

2020年修宪公投完成后，普京有机会再次竞选并连任12年，这次选举正是开启新连任的标志。俄乌冲突的长期化对2024年总统选举也造成了一定的影响。一方面，事关俄罗斯未来的重要规划在战事影响下只能延后，目前普京仍然是凝聚精英阶层和普通民众的关键。另一方面，“特别军事行动”不可避免地对俄罗斯社会生活造成某种程度的冲击，这也成为普京在此次大选要面对的问题。不过，2023年俄罗斯经济相较2022年有所恢复，各方面生活也基本适应了战时新常态。这对稳定大选结果具有重要价值。
2024年年初，俄军攻克乌军据守的阿夫杰耶夫卡，也成为某种意义上的大选加分项。大选在俄罗斯各级政府的保障、组织和推动下，稳步地进行，而莫斯科的红场似乎置身于这场大选之外，兀自筹备着克里米亚“回归十周年”的纪念活动。这么看来，此次大选所蕴含的稳步推进政治进程、保持社会稳定和正常运转的任务已基本实现。
translation:
What’s interesting is that after once again “breaking into” the polling place at a public art training institution on Michiulin Street without any hope, the security guard faced our justified request of “we’re curious and want to see how it’s done.” Two or three leaders asked for permission and finally agreed to let him go. The interior layout of the polling station is quite simple. A classroom was vacated and a high platform with four candidates on it was placed for people to fill in the forms. All three electronic voting machines had black screens and were not working. Further ahead was a row of long tables with people sitting behind them. Several Board of Elections staff and supervisors. During the short stay, people came to vote in groups of twos and threes. Including the staff, security guards, standing leaders and us, two incompatible "curious babies" in the small room, the number of voters far outnumbered the voters. The internal scene of the polling station has actually not changed much from what it was 12 years ago. Today, my trip was finally worthwhile and I left happily. Before leaving, the security guard was amused when he saw the two of us looking satisfied, and couldn't help but asked, "Do you still like it?"
Election posters at the polling station entrance

Another significant difference from 12 years ago is that the publicity for this vote is low-key and the political atmosphere is no longer strong. Except for various advertisements at roadside sites, there seemed to be no atmosphere of an election going on. As online voting becomes more popular, offline sites continue to decrease, and the site in the main building of Moscow State University is no longer set up. What changes technology will bring to elections remains to be seen, but the ritual of putting one person, one vote into the ballot box is irreplaceable.
On the same day as the general election, the focus of publicity in Moscow was also distracted by other cultural activities, giving a sense of "a hundred flowers blooming." For example, this week is also the grand folk festival "Meat Lent" before the Orthodox Lent. There are many market stalls with different themes in Moscow, selling the must-have delicacies of the festival "pancakes", scarecrows and various handicrafts. Full of rich program list. We planned to go straight to the polling station, but we couldn't help but be hindered by the variety of activities on the way. We visited three festival markets located near different city attractions.
The grand "Masantensa" market stage in the center of Moscow

The “Return Commemoration” event in Red Square and the shadow of the Russia-Ukraine conflict
Unexpectedly, Red Square, which was thought to be a key area for election voting, is actually making intensive preparations for another political event to be held after the election. Huge exhibition boards and stages were set up throughout the venue, with printed promotional signs to welcome the 10th anniversary of Crimea's "return to the motherland." The entrance to St. Basil's Cathedral was also blocked by stage equipment and prevented visitors from approaching. Take a photo with the huge display board and the "colorful onions".
Preparations for the next event on Red Square

After the completion of the constitutional referendum in 2020, Putin will have the opportunity to run again and be re-elected for 12 years. This election marks the beginning of a new re-election. The protracted conflict between Russia and Ukraine has also had a certain impact on the 2024 presidential election. On the one hand, important plans related to Russia's future can only be postponed due to the impact of the war. Currently, Putin is still the key to uniting the elite and ordinary people. On the other hand, "special military operations" will inevitably have a certain impact on Russian social life, which has also become a problem that Putin will face in this election. However, the Russian economy will recover in 2023 compared to 2022, and all aspects of life have basically adapted to the new wartime normal. This is of great value in stabilizing the election results.
In early 2024, the Russian army captured Avdeyevka, which was held by the Ukrainian army, which became a bonus in the general election in a sense. The election is proceeding steadily with the guarantee, organization and promotion of the Russian governments at all levels. However, Moscow’s Red Square seems to be staying out of the election, preparing for the commemoration of the “10th anniversary of the return of Crimea”. From this point of view, the tasks contained in this election to steadily advance the political process and maintain social stability and normal operation have been basically achieved.

title: Путин побеждает с 87,28 % голосов: как прошли самые скандальные выборы в истории России. Главные итоги выборов президента России 2024
content: И напоследок, про особенности наших выборов. 17 марта на УИК №1136 в Красносельском районе города Петербурга произошел инцидент на избирательном участке. Полицейские скрутили петербуржца вместе с бюллетенем, когда он голосовал в кабинке. Бдительный страж порядка заподозрил что мужчина, что то пишет на бюллетене, скорее всего оскорбительное, и решил пресечь намечавшееся "преступление". Петербуржцу повезло, его спасла спасла председатель УИК, напомнившая ретивым стражам порядка о тайне голосования. То есть, УК РФ Статья 141. Воспрепятствование осуществлению избирательных прав или работе избирательных комиссий. Действительно, повезло мужчине, а ведь могли бы и пристрелить (шутка).
translation: And finally, about the features of our elections. On March 17, at PEC No. 1136 in the Krasnoselsky district of St. Petersburg, an incident occurred at a polling station. The police tied up the St. Petersburg resident along with his ballot while he was voting in a booth. The vigilant law enforcement officer suspected that the man was writing something on the ballot, most likely offensive, and decided to stop the emerging “crime.” The St. Petersburg resident was lucky; he was saved by the chairman of the precinct election commission, who reminded the zealous law enforcement officers about the secrecy of voting. That is, the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation Article 141. Obstruction of the exercise of electoral rights or the work of election commissions. Indeed, the man was lucky, but he could have been shot (just kidding).
input: And finally, about the features of our elections. On March 17, at PEC No. 1136 in the Krasnoselsky district of St. Petersburg, an incident occurred at a polling station. The police tied up the St. Petersburg resident along with his ballot while he was voting in a booth. The vigilant law enforcement officer suspected that the man was writing something on the ballot, most likely offensive, and decided to stop the emerging “crime.” The St. Petersburg resident was lucky; he was saved by the chairman of the precinct election commission, who reminded the zealous law enforcement officers about the secrecy of voting. That is, the Criminal Code of the Russian Federation Article 141. Obstruction of the exercise of electoral rights or the work of election commissions. Indeed, the man was lucky, but he could have been shot (just kidding).

title: West condemns ‘undemocratic’ Russian election as results show Putin landslide | Russian presidential election 2024 | The Guardian
content:
Western nations have widely condemned Russia’s presidential election, in which Vladimir Putin claimed a landslide victory that will keep him in power until at least 2030 amid a crackdown on dissent and opposition.
“These Russian elections starkly underline the depth of repression under President Putin’s regime, which seeks to silence any opposition to his illegal war,” said the British foreign secretary, David Cameron, as EU foreign ministers met to approve new sanctions against 30 individuals and organisations in response to the death of the Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny.
“Putin removes his political opponents, controls the media, and then crowns himself the winner. This is not democracy,” Cameron said.
In Washington, the state department spokesperson Vedant Patel denounced the election as “undemocratic” and said the US would not congratulate Putin. “This was an incredibly undemocratic process,” Patel told reporters, detailing the jailing and disqualification of opponents and Navalny’s death in an Arctic penal colony. “He is likely to remain the president of Russia, but that does not excuse him of his autocracy,” Patel said.
Calling Russia a dictatorship, a German government spokesperson said the chancellor, Olaf Scholz, would not congratulate Putin on his re-election in a vote viewed by Berlin as “predetermined”.
The official tally from the three-day election was a 87.28% share of the vote for Putin, which the Kremlin on Monday portrayed as a dominant victory, saying the results showed that the people had consolidated around the Russian president.
The Kremlin spokesperson, Dmitry Peskov, told reporters: “This is the most eloquent confirmation of the level of support from the population of the country for its president, and its consolidation around him.

“These Russian elections starkly underline the depth of repression under President Putin’s regime, which seeks to silence any opposition to his illegal war,” said the British foreign secretary, David Cameron, as EU foreign ministers met to approve new sanctions against 30 individuals and organisations in response to the death of the Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny.
“Putin removes his political opponents, controls the media, and then crowns himself the winner. This is not democracy,” Cameron said.
In Washington, the state department spokesperson Vedant Patel denounced the election as “undemocratic” and said the US would not congratulate Putin. “This was an incredibly undemocratic process,” Patel told reporters, detailing the jailing and disqualification of opponents and Navalny’s death in an Arctic penal colony. “He is likely to remain the president of Russia, but that does not excuse him of his autocracy,” Patel said.
Calling Russia a dictatorship, a German government spokesperson said the chancellor, Olaf Scholz, would not congratulate Putin on his re-election in a vote viewed by Berlin as “predetermined”.
The official tally from the three-day election was a 87.28% share of the vote for Putin, which the Kremlin on Monday portrayed as a dominant victory, saying the results showed that the people had consolidated around the Russian president.
The Kremlin spokesperson, Dmitry Peskov, told reporters: “This is the most eloquent confirmation of the level of support from the population of the country for its president, and its consolidation around him.

title: 普京无悬念胜选 演说提与习近平友谊 | 德国之声 来自德国 介绍德国 | DW | 18.03.2024
content:
根据俄国官方周日（3月18日）发布的出口民调，这次总统大选投票率约74.2%，而现任总统普京获得了超過87%的压倒性票数，将让已掌权近25年的普京， 得以迈向第5届总统任期，并且超过斯大林的纪录，成为200多年来执政最久的俄国领袖。
这是后苏联时期最高的一次得票率；上一次俄罗斯总统大选在2018年，当时有67.5%投票率，普京拿到76.7%的票数。 然而，本届选举并无真正意义上的反对派候选人，因此结果毫无悬念。
在出口民调出炉后，普京在莫斯科发表演说感谢俄罗斯民众，并称他选前替不同领域设下的“宏伟计划”都“必定会实现”。
“无论是谁多么想压制我们、打击我们的意志和意识，在历史上从没有人成功过，至今没有成功过，未来也不会。”普京还表示，俄国不排除跟北约展开全面冲突；若果真如此，“距离全面的第三次世界大战只会有一步之遥……相信没有人会希望这样”。
普京提到中国时，强调俄中两国利益相契合，未来几年俄中关系会更加强劲，而他跟中国国家主席习近平的“个人友谊”，也有助于两国关系继续稳定发展。
普京一方面赞许中国在世界舞台上的成功，一方面声称针对中国的挑衅和制裁都“注定失败”。 他也应和中国立场，主张“台湾是中国的一部分”。
translation:
According to Russian official exit polls released on Sunday (March 18), the turnout for this presidential election was about 74.2%, and current President Putin received an overwhelming vote of more than 87%, which will make Putin, who has been in power for nearly 25 years, , was able to move towards the fifth presidential term, and surpassed Stalin's record, becoming the Russian leader with the longest reign in more than 200 years.
This is the highest vote rate in the post-Soviet era; the last Russian presidential election was in 2018, when there was a turnout of 67.5%, and Putin received 76.7% of the votes. However, there is no real opposition candidate in this election, so the outcome is not in doubt.
After the exit polls were released, Putin gave a speech in Moscow to thank the Russian people and said that the "grand plans" he had set for different fields before the election "will definitely be realized."
"No matter how much someone wants to suppress us and attack our will and consciousness, no one has ever succeeded in history, has never succeeded so far, and will not in the future." Putin also said that Russia does not rule out launching a full-scale conflict with NATO; if If so, "we are only one step away from a full-scale World War III... I believe no one would want this."
When Putin mentioned China, he emphasized that the interests of Russia and China coincided with each other. Russia-China relations will become stronger in the next few years, and his "personal friendship" with Chinese President Xi Jinping will also help the relations between the two countries continue to develop steadily.
On the one hand, Putin praised China's success on the world stage, but on the other hand, he claimed that provocations and sanctions against China are "doomed to fail." He should also agree with China's position and advocate that "Taiwan is part of China."

This is the highest vote rate in the post-Soviet era; the last Russian presidential election was in 2018, when there was a turnout of 67.5%, and Putin received 76.7% of the votes. However, there is no real opposition candidate in this election, so the outcome is not in doubt.
After the exit polls were released, Putin gave a speech in Moscow to thank the Russian people and said that the "grand plans" he had set for different fields before the election "will definitely be realized."
"No matter how much someone wants to suppress us and attack our will and consciousness, no one has ever succeeded in history, has never succeeded so far, and will not in the future." Putin also said that Russia does not rule out launching a full-scale conflict with NATO; if If so, "we are only one step away from a full-scale World War III... I believe no one would want this."
When Putin mentioned China, he emphasized that the interests of Russia and China coincided with each other. title: 俄罗斯大选2024｜选票上，除了普京还有谁？
content:
1月下旬，纳杰日丁在各地的签名收集点开始出现排队的情况。1月31日，纳杰日丁称已向中选委提交了10.5万个签名。
俄罗斯中选委2月8日表示，纳杰日丁收集的签名中有9147个为无效签名。其中，858个签名的选民数据不可靠，另有11个签名的人被发现已经离世。因此，纳杰日丁获得的有效签名只有约9.5万个，未能获得参选资格。
敦佐娃
敦佐娃1983年出生于西伯利亚地区的克拉斯诺亚尔斯克，后随家人迁至特维尔州勒热夫市，并在当地高校学习了法律及电视新闻。2003年，敦佐娃在勒热夫市电视台开启了自己的职业生涯。工作一年后，敦佐娃在一所学校担任电视工作室的负责人，随后还和自己的丈夫开始经营一家独立电视公司。她在2019年成为勒热夫市杜马议员。
2023年11月，敦佐娃在社交平台上宣布将参与俄总统选举，并公布了自己的竞选网站。作为独立候选人，敦佐娃必须召集一个不少于500人的倡议小组，并收集来自40个或更多地区至少30万个支持者签名。2023年12月23日，俄罗斯中央选举委员会宣布，由于所提交的参选材料中存在许多不符合标准的错误内容，敦佐娃的参选资格被否决。
translation:
In late January, queues began to form at Nadezhdin’s signature collection points. On January 31, Nadezdin said he had submitted 105,000 signatures to the Central Election Commission.
Russia's Central Election Commission stated on February 8 that 9,147 of the signatures collected by Nadezdin were invalid. Among them, the voter data of 858 signatures was unreliable, and 11 other signatures were found to have passed away. Therefore, Nadezhdin received only about 95,000 valid signatures and was not qualified to run.
Duntsova
Duntsova was born in Krasnoyarsk, Siberia, in 1983. She later moved with her family to Rzhev, Tver Region, and studied law and television journalism at a local university. In 2003, Duntsova started her career at Rzhev City Television. After a year of work, Duntsova worked as the head of a television studio at a school, and then started an independent television company with her husband. She became a member of the Rzhev City Duma in 2019.
In November 2023, Duntsova announced on social platforms that she would participate in the Russian presidential election and announced her campaign website. As an independent candidate, Duntsova must assemble an advocacy group of no less than 500 people and collect at least 300,000 signatures from supporters in 40 or more regions. On December 23, 2023, Russia’s Central Election Commission announced that Duntsova’s qualification to run was rejected due to many substandard errors in the submitted materials.
input:
In late January, queues began to form at Nadezhdin’s signature collection points. On January 31, Nadezdin said he had submitted 105,000 signatures to the Central Election Commission.
Russia's Central Election Commission stated on February 8 that 9,147 of the signatures collected by Nadezdin were invalid. Among them, the voter data of 858 signatures was unreliable, and 11 other signatures were found to have passed away. Therefore, Nadezhdin received only about 95,000 valid signatures and was not qualified to run.
Duntsova
Duntsova was born in Krasnoyarsk, Siberia, in 1983. She later moved with her family to Rzhev, Tver Region, and studied law and television journalism at a local university. In 2003, Duntsova started her career at Rzhev City Television. After a year of work, Duntsova worked as the head of a television studio at a school, and then started an independent television company with her husband. She became a member of the Rzhev City Duma in 2019.
In November 2023, Duntsova announced on social platforms that she would participate in the Russian presidential election and announced her campaign website. As an independent candidate, Duntsova must assemble an advocacy group of no less than 500 people and collect at least 300,000 signatures from supporters in 40 or more regions. On December 23, 2023, Russia’s Central Election Commission announced that Duntsova’s qualification to run was rejected due to many substandard errors in the submitted materials.

title: 全球前瞻｜美众议院本周拟就拜登弹劾调查投票，埃及开启总统大选
content:
据央视新闻报道，俄罗斯联邦共产党中央委员会主席久加诺夫此前表示，俄联邦委员会将于12月13日公布有关总统选举的具体消息。
据此前报道，俄罗斯联邦委员会主席马特维延科证实普京已决定参加俄总统选举。马特维延科说，普京的这一决定是俄罗斯作为强大、安全的主权国家的保障。俄国家杜马副主席、统一俄罗斯党最高委员会成员涅维罗夫表示，该党将无条件支持普京作为候选人参加总统选举。
据中新网援引路透社报道，俄罗斯前地方电视台记者叶卡捷琳娜·敦佐娃(Yekaterina Duntsova)表示希望参加竞选俄罗斯总统，并称俄罗斯应该结束特别军事行动。
俄罗斯总统大选按计划将在明年3月举行,具体投票日期为2024年3月15日、16日和17日。
独联体成员国政府首脑会晤将于12月18日在莫斯科举行
莫斯科。澎湃影像 资料图

据央视新闻报道，独联体成员国政府首脑会晤将于12月18日在莫斯科举行。独立国家联合体（独联体）秘书长谢尔盖·列别杰夫表示，独联体国家政府首脑会议是由俄罗斯倡议的一次特别会议，独联体国家将在此次会议开展对独联体活动的评估并讨论各国所关注的议题。
列别杰夫还称，独联体国家领导人非正式会晤将于12月26日在俄罗斯圣彼得堡举行。此外，12月25日圣彼得堡还将举行欧亚经济联盟最高权力机构欧亚经济委员会最高理事会会议。
translation:
According to CCTV News, Chairman of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of the Russian Federation Zyuganov previously stated that the Russian Federation Council will announce specific information about the presidential election on December 13.
According to previous reports, Russian Federation Council Chairman Matviyenko confirmed that Putin has decided to participate in the Russian presidential election. Matviyenko said that Putin’s decision is a guarantee for Russia as a strong, secure and sovereign country. Nevirov, deputy chairman of the Russian State Duma and member of the Supreme Committee of the United Russia Party, said that the party will unconditionally support Putin as a candidate to participate in the presidential election.
According to a Reuters report quoted by China News Service, former Russian local TV reporter Yekaterina Duntsova expressed her hope to run for Russian president and said that Russia should end special military operations.
The Russian presidential election is scheduled to be held in March next year, with specific voting dates being March 15, 16 and 17, 2024.
The meeting of heads of government of the CIS member states will be held in Moscow on December 18
Moscow. ThePaper Image data map

According to CCTV news reports, the heads of government meeting of the CIS member states will be held in Moscow on December 18. Sergey Lebedev, Secretary-General of the Commonwealth of Independent States (CIS), said that the CIS Heads of Government Summit is a special meeting initiated by Russia, at which the CIS countries will carry out their work on the CIS assessment of sports activities and discuss issues of concern to each country.
Lebedev also said that an informal meeting of leaders of the CIS countries will be held in St. Petersburg, Russia, on December 26. In addition, a meeting of the Supreme Council of the Eurasian Economic Commission, the highest authority of the Eurasian Economic Union, will be held in St. Petersburg on December 25.
input:
According to CCTV News, Chairman of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of the Russian Federation Zyuganov previously stated that the Russian Federation Council will announce specific information about the presidential election on December 13.
According to previous reports, Russian Federation Council Chairman Matviyenko confirmed that Putin has decided to participate in the Russian presidential election. Matviyenko said that Putin’s decision is a guarantee for Russia as a strong, secure and sovereign country. Nevirov, deputy chairman of the Russian State Duma and member of the Supreme Committee of the United Russia Party, said that the party will unconditionally support Putin as a candidate to participate in the presidential election.
According to a Reuters report quoted by China News Service, former Russian local TV reporter Yekaterina Duntsova expressed her hope to run for Russian president and said that Russia should end special military operations.
The Russian presidential election is scheduled to be held in March next year, with specific voting dates being March 15, 16 and 17, 2024.
The meeting of heads of government of the CIS member states will be held in Moscow on December 18
Moscow. ThePaper Image data map

According to CCTV news reports, the heads of government meeting of the CIS member states will be held in Moscow on December 18. Sergey Lebedev, Secretary-General of the Commonwealth of Independent States (CIS), said that the CIS Heads of Government Summit is a special meeting initiated by Russia, at which the CIS countries will carry out their work on the CIS assessment of sports activities and discuss issues of concern to each country.
Lebedev also said that an informal meeting of leaders of the CIS countries will be held in St. Petersburg, Russia, on December 26. In addition, a meeting of the Supreme Council of the Eurasian Economic Commission, the highest authority of the Eurasian Economic Union, will be held in St. Petersburg on December 25.

title: Putin extends rule in predetermined Russian election after harshest crackdown since Soviet era | KSL.com
content:
President Vladimir Putin extended his reign over Russia in a landslide election whose outcome was never in doubt, declaring his determination Monday to advance deeper into Ukraine and dangling new threats against the West.
After the harshest crackdown on dissent since Soviet times, it was clear from the earliest returns that Putin's nearly quarter-century rule would continue with a fifth term that grants him six more years. Still, Russians heeded a call to protest Putin's repression and his war in Ukraine by showing up at polling stations at noon Sunday.
With all the precincts counted Monday, election officials said Putin had secured a record number of votes, underlining his total control over the political system. U.S. and other Western leaders denounced the election as a sham.
U.S. national security adviser Jake Sullivan said there was "nothing free or fair" about the election but seemingly resisted calls from Russia's opposition to not recognize Putin as the winner.
Ahead of the election, Putin's greatest political foe, Alexei Navalny, died in an Arctic penal colony, anti-war candidates were barred from the ballot and independent voices were silenced in a Kremlin-backed media blockade.
input:
President Vladimir Putin extended his reign over Russia in a landslide election whose outcome was never in doubt, declaring his determination Monday to advance deeper into Ukraine and dangling new threats against the West.
After the harshest crackdown on dissent since Soviet times, it was clear from the earliest returns that Putin's nearly quarter-century rule would continue with a fifth term that grants him six more years. Still, Russians heeded a call to protest Putin's repression and his war in Ukraine by showing up at polling stations at noon Sunday.
With all the precincts counted Monday, election officials said Putin had secured a record number of votes, underlining his total control over the political system. U.S. and other Western leaders denounced the election as a sham.
U.S. national security adviser Jake Sullivan said there was "nothing free or fair" about the election but seemingly resisted calls from Russia's opposition to not recognize Putin as the winner.
Ahead of the election, Putin's greatest political foe, Alexei Navalny, died in an Arctic penal colony, anti-war candidates were barred from the ballot and independent voices were silenced in a Kremlin-backed media blockade.

title: 俄罗斯大选2024｜五个“首次”，这场选举有何特殊？
content:
对于符合规定且有意参与总统选举的人来说，可以通过政党提名和自荐两种方式参选。
政党提名这一方式存在两种情况。第一类为进入俄国家杜马的政党，目前包括统一俄罗斯党、俄联邦共产党、俄自由民主党、公俄党（“公正俄罗斯－爱国者－为了真理”党）及新人党五个党派。由上述政党提名者将直接被登记为候选人。而对于其他未进入俄国家杜马的政党而言，由其提名的候选人需要收集10万个支持者的签名，并交由俄罗斯中央委员会审查。
对于自荐者而言，获得参选资格则较为复杂。其首先需要召集一个不少于500人的倡议小组，小组与会者要通过多数表决是否赞成该自荐者参选，还需收集来自40个或更多地区的至少30万个支持者的签名。在俄中选委审查完毕后，方可被登记为候选人。
在2024年俄罗斯大选的4名候选人中，只有普京为独立候选人，通过自荐方式获得参选资格。其余3人分别由俄自由民主党、俄共、新人党提名。
据新华社此前报道，俄罗斯中央选举委员会主席帕姆菲洛娃今年1月29日在新闻发布会上宣布，普京已被正式登记为2024年总统选举候选人。在普京竞选总部提交的约31.5万个支持者签名中，中央选举委员会随机选取6万个签名进行核验，结果显示91个签名无效，符合登记为总统选举候选人的有关规定。
translation:
For those who meet the regulations and intend to participate in the presidential election, they can participate in the election through two methods: party nomination and self-recommendation.
There are two situations in this method of party nomination. The first category is the political parties that have entered the Russian State Duma, currently including the United Russia Party, the Communist Party of the Russian Federation, the Russian Liberal Democratic Party, the Public Russia Party (the "Just Russia-Patriots-For Truth" Party) and the New People's Party. Candidates nominated by the above-mentioned political parties will be registered directly as candidates. For other political parties that have not entered the Russian State Duma, candidates nominated by them need to collect the signatures of 100,000 supporters and submit them to the Russian Central Committee for review.
For self-recommended candidates, obtaining qualifications is more complicated. It first needs to convene an initiative group of no less than 500 people. The group participants must vote by majority to approve the self-recommended person's candidacy. It also needs to collect the signatures of at least 300,000 supporters from 40 or more regions. Candidates can be registered only after the review by the Russian-Chinese Election Commission.
Among the four candidates for the 2024 Russian general election, only Putin is an independent candidate and qualified to run through self-recommendation. The remaining three people were nominated by the Liberal Democratic Party of Russia, the Russian Communist Party, and the New People's Party.
According to previous reports from Xinhua News Agency, Pamfilova, chairwoman of the Russian Central Election Commission, announced at a press conference on January 29 this year that Putin had been officially registered as a candidate for the 2024 presidential election. Among the approximately 315,000 signatures of supporters submitted by Putin’s campaign headquarters, the Central Election Commission randomly selected 60,000 signatures for verification. The results showed that 91 signatures were invalid and complied with the relevant regulations for registering as a candidate for the presidential election.
input:
For those who meet the regulations and intend to participate in the presidential election, they can participate in the election through two methods: party nomination and self-recommendation.
There are two situations in this method of party nomination. The first category is the political parties that have entered the Russian State Duma, currently including the United Russia Party, the Communist Party of the Russian Federation, the Russian Liberal Democratic Party, the Public Russia Party (the "Just Russia-Patriots-For Truth" Party) and the New People's Party. Candidates nominated by the above-mentioned political parties will be registered directly as candidates. For other political parties that have not entered the Russian State Duma, candidates nominated by them need to collect the signatures of 100,000 supporters and submit them to the Russian Central Committee for review.
For self-recommended candidates, obtaining qualifications is more complicated. It first needs to convene an initiative group of no less than 500 people. The group participants must vote by majority to approve the self-recommended person's candidacy. It also needs to collect the signatures of at least 300,000 supporters from 40 or more regions. Candidates can be registered only after the review by the Russian-Chinese Election Commission.
Among the four candidates for the 2024 Russian general election, only Putin is an independent candidate and qualified to run through self-recommendation. The remaining three people were nominated by the Liberal Democratic Party of Russia, the Russian Communist Party, and the New People's Party.
According to previous reports from Xinhua News Agency, Pamfilova, chairwoman of the Russian Central Election Commission, announced at a press conference on January 29 this year that Putin had been officially registered as a candidate for the 2024 presidential election. Among the approximately 315,000 signatures of supporters submitted by Putin’s campaign headquarters, the Central Election Commission randomly selected 60,000 signatures for verification. The results showed that 91 signatures were invalid and complied with the relevant regulations for registering as a candidate for the presidential election.

title: 普京：乌军进攻俄本土试图扰乱俄总统选举投票
content:
俄罗斯总统普京15日说，乌克兰军队近日多次试图进攻俄罗斯本土均未取得成功，乌军试图通过袭击扰乱俄总统选举投票。
普京当天以视频形式与俄安全会议成员举行会议时说，从12日至今，乌方主要利用特种部队、外国雇佣兵和乌军支援部队多次试图进入俄领土，制造了多起破坏和恐怖袭击事件，其中4起发生在别尔哥罗德方向，一起发生在库尔斯克方向。
普京说，乌军为此动用了超过2500人、35辆坦克和40辆装甲车，但未取得成功，且因此损失60%的人员和超过50%的装甲装备。
他还强调，乌军上述行动从军事角度看“毫无意义”，从人道角度看则是“犯罪行为”，其目的是扰乱俄总统选举投票进程，对与乌克兰接壤地区的俄平民进行“恐吓”。
俄罗斯国防部15日发表通报说，12日至14日，俄武装部队同俄联邦安全局边防部门一同挫败了乌武装人员突入俄别尔哥罗德州和库尔斯克州领土的行动，乌方在行动中损失了1500多名军人，其中约500人死亡，另有18辆坦克和23辆装甲车被摧毁。
2024年俄罗斯总统选举正式投票于15日至17日举行。据俄总统网站消息，普京15日以在线形式参与了总统选举投票。
translation:
Russian President Vladimir Putin said on the 15th that the Ukrainian army had repeatedly attempted to attack the Russian mainland in recent days without success, and that the Ukrainian army was trying to disrupt the Russian presidential election voting through attacks.
Putin held a video meeting with members of the Russian Security Council that day and said that since the 12th, Ukraine has mainly used special forces, foreign mercenaries and Ukrainian army support forces to try to enter Russian territory many times and cause many sabotages and terrorist attacks. Incidents, four of which occurred in the direction of Belgorod and one in the direction of Kursk.
Putin said that the Ukrainian army used more than 2,500 men, 35 tanks and 40 armored vehicles for this purpose, but failed, and as a result, it lost 60% of its personnel and more than 50% of its armored equipment.
He also emphasized that the above-mentioned actions of the Ukrainian army are "meaningless" from a military perspective and "criminal acts" from a humanitarian perspective. Their purpose is to disrupt the Russian presidential election voting process and "terrorize Russian civilians in areas bordering Ukraine" ".
The Russian Ministry of Defense issued a report on the 15th stating that from the 12th to the 14th, the Russian Armed Forces and the border defense department of the Russian Federal Security Service jointly defeated the actions of Ukrainian armed personnel to break into the territory of Russia’s Belgorod and Kursk regions. More than 1,500 soldiers were lost in the operation, about 500 of whom were killed, and 18 tanks and 23 armored vehicles were destroyed.
Official voting for the 2024 Russian presidential election will be held from the 15th to the 17th. According to the Russian President’s website, Putin participated in the presidential election vote online on the 15th.
input:
Russian President Vladimir Putin said on the 15th that the Ukrainian army had repeatedly attempted to attack the Russian mainland in recent days without success, and that the Ukrainian army was trying to disrupt the Russian presidential election voting through attacks.
Putin held a video meeting with members of the Russian Security Council that day and said that since the 12th, Ukraine has mainly used special forces, foreign mercenaries and Ukrainian army support forces to try to enter Russian territory many times and cause many sabotages and terrorist attacks. Incidents, four of which occurred in the direction of Belgorod and one in the direction of Kursk.
Putin said that the Ukrainian army used more than 2,500 men, 35 tanks and 40 armored vehicles for this purpose, but failed, and as a result, it lost 60% of its personnel and more than 50% of its armored equipment.
He also emphasized that the above-mentioned actions of the Ukrainian army are "meaningless" from a military perspective and "criminal acts" from a humanitarian perspective. Their purpose is to disrupt the Russian presidential election voting process and "terrorize Russian civilians in areas bordering Ukraine" ".
The Russian Ministry of Defense issued a report on the 15th stating that from the 12th to the 14th, the Russian Armed Forces and the border defense department of the Russian Federal Security Service jointly defeated the actions of Ukrainian armed personnel to break into the territory of Russia’s Belgorod and Kursk regions. More than 1,500 soldiers were lost in the operation, about 500 of whom were killed, and 18 tanks and 23 armored vehicles were destroyed.
Official voting for the 2024 Russian presidential election will be held from the 15th to the 17th. According to the Russian President’s website, Putin participated in the presidential election vote online on the 15th.

title: 中俄独裁者互祝连任 “友谊”会突变吗？ | 普京 | 习近平 | 俄罗斯 | 大纪元
content:
两个国家在政治上独裁，普京的很多做法，习近平也都有在参考。
赖荣伟说，中共在民主社会的围堵之下，需要有一个合作的伙伴。而普京深陷乌克兰的战争，俄罗斯被西方社会制裁，俄中之间现在经济上的互补比以前更高。
已持续两年多的俄乌战争仍在胶着中。上个月，中方证实普京将于今年再度出访中国，这将是普京自执掌俄罗斯政权以来的第19次访华。
据中共海关总署的统计，2022年，中俄双边贸易额达到了创纪录的1902.7亿美元，同比增长29.3%。在俄乌战争爆发、俄罗斯面临西方社会制裁的情况下，中国成为俄罗斯最重要的贸易伙伴。
俄罗斯总统大选后，普京在3月18日警告称，俄罗斯如果与北约发生直接冲突，就离所谓的第三次世界大战仅一步之遥了。欧盟方面则对普京发出再次警告并决心继续支持乌克兰。
赖荣伟说，普京这种狠话谁都会讲，就像金正恩一天到晚也会讲说他要炸毁韩国，这只是一种吓阻。但是国际上也要团结起来，要集体来吓阻它，就像台湾要吓阻中共，最好的方式就是联合所有的台湾朋友一起。
2023年3月22日，习近平结束3天的访俄行程，在离开克里姆林宫时，对普京说了一句话，称所谓百年变局“我们共同来推动”。普京则回应同意。当时外界认为，习暗示的就是试图联手搅乱“世界秩序”。
赖荣伟说，中俄两个独裁政权现在在联手推翻国际秩序，最主要的敌人就是美国和欧盟。
翁明贤表示，所谓百年大变局，还有一个影响因素，也就是美国总统大选将在11月5日举行。如果是拜登当选，会继续形成美国要对付中国和俄罗斯战略结盟的紧张态势。但另外一个变数是，如果川普当选之后，以川普的领导风格，可能是以美国优先来推行全球战略，这对中俄的所谓全球战略格局也会形成另外一种风险。
赖荣伟说，美国不管是川普还是拜登当总统，俄罗斯和北约对抗、美中对抗都会持续下去。
他分析说，因为中俄被认为是邪恶阵营，这是指向和西方在价值观方面的对抗。比如美国经常点名指俄罗斯和中国干预他们的选举，台湾也一直在讲中共搞认知作战。就是中俄都在利用模糊的空间和手法要改变现状，利用西方自由民主的价值观和经济自由的常态来进行它具有阴谋的渗透。这方面国际社会应有所警惕。
translation:
The two countries are politically authoritarian, and Xi Jinping also refers to many of Putin's practices.
Lai Rongwei said that under the siege of a democratic society, the CCP needs a cooperative partner. While Putin is deeply involved in the war in Ukraine and Russia is sanctioned by Western society, the economic complementarity between Russia and China is now higher than before.
The Russia-Ukraine war, which has lasted for more than two years, is still in a stalemate. Last month, China confirmed that Putin will visit China again this year. This will be Putin's 19th visit to China since taking power in Russia.
According to statistics from the General Administration of Customs of the Communist Party of China, in 2022, the bilateral trade volume between China and Russia reached a record high of 190.27 billion U.S. dollars, a year-on-year increase of 29.3%. When the Russo-Ukrainian war broke out and Russia faced sanctions from Western societies, China became Russia's most important trading partner.
After the Russian presidential election, Putin warned on March 18 that if Russia had a direct conflict with NATO, it would be only one step away from the so-called World War III. The European Union issued another warning to Putin and determined to continue supporting Ukraine.
Lai Rongwei said that anyone can say cruel things like Putin, just like Kim Jong-un who talks about blowing up South Korea all day long. This is just a kind of intimidation. But the international community must also unite and collectively deter it. Just like Taiwan wants to deter the CCP, the best way is to unite all Taiwanese friends.
On March 22, 2023, Xi Jinping ended his three-day visit to Russia. When leaving the Kremlin, he said something to Putin, saying that "we will promote the so-called changes in a century together." Putin responded in agreement. At that time, outsiders believed that what Xi was hinting at was an attempt to join forces to disrupt the "world order."
Lai Rongwei said that the two authoritarian regimes of China and Russia are now joining forces to overthrow the international order, and their main enemies are the United States and the European Union.
Weng Mingxian said that there is another influencing factor in the so-called century-old changes, that is, the US presidential election will be held on November 5. If Biden is elected, it will continue to create a tense situation in which the United States has to deal with the strategic alliance between China and Russia. But another variable is that if Trump is elected, with Trump’s leadership style, he may put the United States first to implement global strategy, which will also pose another risk to the so-called global strategic pattern of China and Russia.
Lai Rongwei said that no matter whether Trump or Biden is president of the United States, the confrontation between Russia and NATO and the confrontation between the United States and China will continue.
He analyzed that because China and Russia are considered to be the evil camp, this points to confrontation with the West in terms of values. For example, the United States often names Russia and China for interfering in their elections, and Taiwan has also been talking about the CCP's cognitive warfare. Both China and Russia are using vague spaces and techniques to change the status quo, and are using the values ​​of Western liberal democracy and the normal state of economic freedom to carry out their conspiratorial infiltration. The international community should be vigilant in this regard.

title: 俄罗斯大选2024·专访｜科尔图诺夫：存在与北约发生直接冲突的可能
content:
如今，俄罗斯与北约之间的许多沟通渠道已经失灵，这使得局势更加严峻。如果俄罗斯与北约之间真的发生直接军事冲突，很可能达到核战争的程度。因此，必须不惜一切代价防止这种冲突的发生。 
普京的下一个六年：政权过渡、经济发展与持续和平
澎湃新闻：最近，我们和许多俄罗斯普通人聊了聊他们对战争的感受。我们发现，许多俄罗斯人希望看到战争尽快结束。如何看待这种情绪对俄罗斯社会及政治局势的影响？
安德烈·科尔图诺夫：当然，我们都希望尽快结束特别军事行动。问题是，俄罗斯方面可以接受在什么条件下结束这一行动。俄罗斯社会有“鹰派”和“鸽派”之分。“鹰派”要求“战争必须取得彻底胜利”，而“鸽派”则认为有必要尽快开始和平谈判。但这些讨论对俄罗斯的社会政治局势影响甚微，因为它们主要是在专家层面进行的。
澎湃新闻：普京正在迈向他的第五个任期，在未来6年他将面临哪些挑战、需要完成哪些任务？其中哪些最为紧迫、最为关键？
安德烈·科尔图诺夫：如今，政治家的政治任期可以拉得很长。但假设本届总统任期很可能是普京的最后一届总统任期，那么普京面临的主要挑战就是加强国家机构建设，确保向新一代政治领导人平稳过渡，减少痛苦。
当然，另一个挑战是制定并实施国家社会经济发展的新模式，使俄罗斯能够融入正在第四次工业革命（注：以人工智能、大数据、云计算、生物技术等为代表的科技创新所驱动、以智能化为标志的新一轮工业革命）过程中崛起的未来全球经济。此外，还要结束与乌克兰和西方的冲突——至少是欧洲中心最具破坏性的军事冲突。没有持续的和平，任何其他战略目标都将难以实现。
translation:
Today, many communication channels between Russia and NATO have failed, making the situation even more serious. If there is a direct military conflict between Russia and NATO, it is likely to reach the level of nuclear war. Therefore, such conflicts must be prevented at all costs. 
Putin’s Next Six Years: Regime Transition, Economic Development and Sustained Peace
The Paper: Recently, we talked with many ordinary Russians about their feelings about the war. We found that many Russians wanted to see the war end as quickly as possible. How do you view the impact of this sentiment on the social and political situation in Russia?
Andrei Kortunov: Of course, we all want to end special military operations as soon as possible. The question is, under what conditions is Russia acceptable to end this operation. Russian society is divided into "hawks" and "doves". The "hawks" demand that "the war must be completely victorious," while the "doves" believe that it is necessary to start peace negotiations as soon as possible. But these discussions had little impact on the sociopolitical situation in Russia, as they were mainly conducted at the expert level.
The Paper: Putin is entering his fifth term. What challenges will he face and what tasks will he need to complete in the next six years? Which of them are the most urgent and critical?
Andrei Kortunov: Nowadays, the political tenure of politicians can be very long. But assuming that this presidential term is likely to be Putin's last, then Putin's main challenge is to strengthen state institutions and ensure a smooth and less painful transition to a new generation of political leaders.
Of course, another challenge is to formulate and implement a new model of national socio-economic development so that Russia can integrate into the ongoing Fourth Industrial Revolution (note: driven by technological innovations represented by artificial intelligence, big data, cloud computing, biotechnology, etc. , a new round of industrial revolution marked by intelligence) and the future global economy emerging in the process. And also to end the conflict with Ukraine and the West - at least the most damaging military conflict in the heart of Europe. Without sustained peace, any other strategic goal will be difficult to achieve.
input:
Today, many communication channels between Russia and NATO have failed, making the situation even more serious. If there is a direct military conflict between Russia and NATO, it is likely to reach the level of nuclear war. Therefore, such conflicts must be prevented at all costs. 
Putin’s Next Six Years: Regime Transition, Economic Development and Sustained Peace
The Paper: Recently, we talked with many ordinary Russians about their feelings about the war. We found that many Russians wanted to see the war end as quickly as possible. How do you view the impact of this sentiment on the social and political situation in Russia?
Andrei Kortunov: Of course, we all want to end special military operations as soon as possible. The question is, under what conditions is Russia acceptable to end this operation. Russian society is divided into "hawks" and "doves". The "hawks" demand that "the war must be completely victorious," while the "doves" believe that it is necessary to start peace negotiations as soon as possible. But these discussions had little impact on the sociopolitical situation in Russia, as they were mainly conducted at the expert level.
The Paper: Putin is entering his fifth term. What challenges will he face and what tasks will he need to complete in the next six years? Which of them are the most urgent and critical?
Andrei Kortunov: Nowadays, the political tenure of politicians can be very long. But assuming that this presidential term is likely to be Putin's last, then Putin's main challenge is to strengthen state institutions and ensure a smooth and less painful transition to a new generation of political leaders.
Of course, another challenge is to formulate and implement a new model of national socio-economic development so that Russia can integrate into the ongoing Fourth Industrial Revolution (note: driven by technological innovations represented by artificial intelligence, big data, cloud computing, biotechnology, etc. , a new round of industrial revolution marked by intelligence) and the future global economy emerging in the process. And also to end the conflict with Ukraine and the West - at least the most damaging military conflict in the heart of Europe. Without sustained peace, any other strategic goal will be difficult to achieve.

title: 路透：普京“胜选连任”后五月将访华与习近平举行峰会
content:
克里姆林宫发言人德米特里·佩斯科夫（Dmitry Peskov）在被问及路透社有关普京即将访华的报道时表示，有关普京出访的信息会在日期临近时对外公布。
“目前正在规划好几个总统访问行程和好几个高层接触的行程，”佩斯科夫对记者说。“我们会在日期临近时通知你们。”
普京2022年2月悍然挥军入侵乌克兰后，俄罗斯遭到美国和西方盟国的强烈谴责和一轮又一轮严厉的制裁。但是北京不仅没有指责莫斯科的侵略行动，反而趁机加强与俄罗斯的政治、外交和经贸关系，甚至大肆购买俄罗斯因为西方制裁卖不掉而被迫打折出售的能源产品。
普京在发动乌克兰战争前曾专门访问北京，并与习近平签署了一系列号称“上不封顶”的合作文件。中俄两国在面对美国和西方抵制时背靠背抱团取暖的意图十分明显。
美国目前将中国定位为其最大的战略竞争对手，并将俄罗斯视为构成最大威胁的国家。拜登总统一再表示，民主与威权两大阵营的竞争与对决将贯穿21世纪始终。
路透社报道说，习近平与普京两人世界观相同，都视西方腐朽衰落，而中国更是在多个领域挑战美国的霸主地位，从量子计算到合成生物学到军事科技与力量几乎无所不包。
普京预定5月7日左右举行新的总统就职典礼。西方外交官和观察家早就预言，普京会选择北京作为他新任期出访的第一站。
普京星期天向记者表示，俄罗斯与中国对全球事务看法相似，而且由于他与习近平私交很好，两国关系也具有很强的韧性。普京称，莫斯科和北京未来几年将进一步深化双边关系。
习近平在打破中共几十年来的惯例谋取第三个任期后不久，也于去年3月访问了莫斯科。普京与习近平经常吹嘘他们两人之间的密切关系，两人会面已经超过40次。普京与习近平上一次见面是在去年10月，当时普京前往北京出席一带一路高峰论坛。
中国在俄罗斯入侵乌克兰遭到西方严厉制裁后，一直默默在向俄罗斯提供外交支持和经济协助。但是北京当局也不忘高调呼吁在乌克兰“停火止战”。中国政府欧亚事务特别代表李辉曾经两次出访俄罗斯和乌克兰以及欧洲多国，号称为和平穿针引线。但是，由于中方的和平建议并未涉及俄罗斯从乌克兰被占领土撤军这一关键的诉求，因此基辅及其西方盟友并不特别看好北京的斡旋努力。
中国驻瑞士大使王世廷星期一在接受瑞士媒体采访时表示，北京正在考虑参与瑞士为结束乌克兰战争而将在几个月后举办的一场和平会议。
translation:
Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov, when asked about Reuters reports about Putin's upcoming visit to China, said that information about Putin's visit will be released closer to the date.
"We are currently planning several presidential visits and several high-level contacts," Peskov told reporters. "We will let you know as the date approaches."
After Putin brazenly invaded Ukraine in February 2022, Russia was strongly condemned by the United States and Western allies and imposed rounds of severe sanctions. However, Beijing not only failed to accuse Moscow of its aggressive actions, but instead took the opportunity to strengthen political, diplomatic, and economic and trade relations with Russia, and even bought energy products that Russia was forced to sell at a discount due to Western sanctions.
Before launching the war in Ukraine, Putin made a special visit to Beijing and signed a series of cooperation documents with Xi Jinping known as "unlimited". China and Russia have obvious intentions of holding back-to-back to warm up in the face of resistance from the United States and the West.
The United States currently positions China as its biggest strategic competitor and views Russia as the country that poses the greatest threat. President Biden has repeatedly stated that competition and confrontation between the two camps of democracy and authoritarianism will continue throughout the 21st century.
Reuters reported that Xi Jinping and Putin share the same world view and both view the West as decadent and declining, while China is challenging the United States’ hegemony in many fields, including almost everything from quantum computing to synthetic biology to military technology and power. .
Putin is scheduled to hold a new presidential inauguration around May 7. Western diplomats and observers have long predicted that Putin would choose Beijing as the first stop of his overseas trip during his new term.
Putin told reporters on Sunday that Russia and China have similar views on global affairs and that their relationship is highly resilient because of his close personal relationship with Xi. Putin said that Moscow and Beijing will further deepen their bilateral relations in the coming years.
Xi Jinping also visited Moscow in March last year, shortly after breaking with decades of CCP practice to seek a third term. Putin and Xi Jinping often boast of their close relationship and have met more than 40 times. The last time Putin and Xi Jinping met was in October last year, when Putin went to Beijing to attend the Belt and Road Forum.
China has been quietly providing diplomatic support and economic assistance to Russia after Russia was severely sanctioned by the West for its invasion of Ukraine. However, the Beijing authorities have also not forgotten to make high-profile calls for a "ceasefire and an end to the war" in Ukraine. Li Hui, the Chinese government's special representative for Eurasian affairs, has visited Russia, Ukraine and many European countries twice, claiming to be a thread for peace. However, because China's peace proposal does not address the key demand of Russia's withdrawal from occupied Ukrainian territories, Kyiv and its Western allies are not particularly optimistic about Beijing's mediation efforts.
China's ambassador to Switzerland Wang Shiting said in an interview with Swiss media on Monday that Beijing was considering participating in a peace conference that Switzerland will host in a few months to end the war in Ukraine.
